0.title: Myntra to hire 16,000 people to meet festive season demand
0.article_body: Fashion e-tailer Myntra has announced that it will hire around 16,000 people directly and indirectly to meet the demands of the upcoming festive season. Nupur Nagpal, Chief Human Resources Officer, said the company is looking at a 45% increase in seasonal job creation with over 6,300 people to aid in first-mile and mid-mile logistics and over 3,000 for last-mile deliveries.

1.title: 35-yr-old woman dies as fire breaks out in shop in UP's Shamli
1.article_body: A 35-year-old woman was charred to death after fire broke out at a grocery shop in Uttar Pradesh's Shamli district on Friday. According to SHO Anil Kumar, the victim was sleeping in the shop while her husband, Sajid, was in the upper storey when the fire broke out. Sajid claimed the fire broke out due to an electrical short-circuit.

2.title: Industries in Pune's Chakan shifting to railways to transport goods
2.article_body: The Federation of Chakan Industries in Pune has met senior railway officials to discuss increasing the volume of goods being transported through the rail network. "Due to rising fuel prices impacting road transport cost...we will now move to railway transport," said Dilip Batwal, Secretary of the federation. The federation is planning to shift to railways in a phased manner.

3.title: Madras HC acquits man who carried heroin thinking it was wheat flour
3.article_body: The Madras High Court acquitted a man who was caught carrying heroin at the Chennai airport in 2014. The court accepted his claim that he thought the packet he was asked to carry by another person contained wheat flour and tamarind. He was earlier convicted and sentenced to 10 years of imprisonment by a trial court.

4.title: Eastern parts of Pune to face water cut on September 11
4.article_body: Some areas in eastern Pune will face a water supply cut on September 11. The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) along with MSEDCL will carry out maintenance work at Bhama-Askhed pumping station. As per PMC, the areas to be affected include Lohegaon, Viman Nagar, Vadgaonsheri, Kalyaninagar, Vishrantwadi, Phulenagar, Yerawada, Kalas and Dhanori. The water supply will likely be back on Monday.

5.title: TIME honours Queen Elizabeth II with commemorative cover featuring her portrait aged 42
5.article_body: TIME Magazine released a commemorative cover in the honour of Queen Elizabeth II, who died on Thursday at the age of 96. The image on the cover was taken in 1968 when she was 42. In the photo, taken by British photographer Sir Cecil Beaton, the Queen can be seen in the Admiral's Boat Cloak.

6.title: Russia is preventing access to Ukraine war prisoners: UN
6.article_body: The head of UN Human Rights Monitoring Mission in Ukraine, Matilda Bogner, said that Russia is not allowing access to Ukrainian prisoners of war (POWs). "This is all the more worrying since we have documented that prisoners of war in the power of Russia...and held by...Russian armed forces or by affiliated armed groups have suffered torture and ill-treatment," she added.

7.title: Man arrested for cheating people of ₹2.5 cr on promise of jobs in Assam
7.article_body: A 30-year-old man was arrested in Assam for allegedly cheating people on the pretext of providing them jobs. The accused, identified as Dipjyoti Das, pretended to be an employee of Indian Oil Corporation Ltd and demanded money from people by promising them jobs at the company's Noonmati unit in Assam. He had duped 31 people of ₹2.5 crore, police said.

8.title: 6 arrested, stolen valuables worth ₹6.65 lakh recovered in Thane
8.article_body: The Thane Police arrested six persons for their involvement in 11 theft cases in Rabodi and Naupada police station limits and recovered valuables worth ₹6.65 lakh, police said. The recovered items included three auto-rickshaws, one mobile phone, one two-wheeler, jewellery and cash. "The modus operandi was that they...targeted the houses that were not covered by CCTV systems," police added.

9.title: I'm in same place where we spent many evenings: Vivek remembers Sushant
9.article_body: Filmmaker Vivek Agnihotri on Thursday posted a picture with late actor Sushant Singh Rajput on social media. He wrote in the caption, "Remembering Sushant Singh Rajput. Am exactly at the same place where we spent many evenings talking about life, cosmos, God's particle, Shekhar Kapur's 'Paani' and struggles of a middle class, small town person in Bollywood."

10.title: Man suspects father has illicit relations with wife, kills him in MP
10.article_body: A 25-year-old man was arrested after he allegedly murdered his 70-year-old father using an axe in Madhya Pradesh's Katni, police said on Thursday. "[The accused] suspected that his father was having illicit relations with his wife. After a dispute, he hit his father...with an axe," a police station in charge said. The incident took place on Tuesday.

11.title: Everyone used to ask me to play Hansa at school functions: Supriya's daughter
11.article_body: Sanah Kapur, actress Supriya Pathak's daughter, said when she was in middle school, her mother's character from 'Khichdi', Hansa, had become "quite a rage". She added everyone used to ask her to play Hansa during her school's annual functions. "I used to...hate it...I was terrible (at it) and I didn't want to do...mom's role because that's insane pressure," said Sanah.

12.title: UP govt should focus on improving condition of madrassas: Mayawati
12.article_body: Former UP CM Mayawati on Friday criticised the state government's decision to conduct a survey of madrassas. "The government should focus on improving the condition of government-aided madrassas and government schools," she tweeted. She said that while exploitation of Muslims under the Congress rule was usual, their oppression by BJP after coming to power is sad and condemnable.

13.title: Labourers find abandoned newborn in bushes in Kerala; probe on
13.article_body: A group of migrant labourers found an abandoned newborn girl in the bushes after they were startled by a cry while searching the area for discarded things in Kerala's Alappuzha on Friday. A probe has been launched to find the mother of the infant. The infant has been taken to a state-run hospital, according to the police.

14.title: 80-yr-old killed, 300 vehicles burnt as fire breaks out in J'khand showroom
14.article_body: An 80-year-old woman was killed while about 300 two-wheelers worth crores were burnt after a fire broke out in a showroom in Jharkhand. The fire broke out on Thursday night, reports said. Reports added that fire tenders were deployed to put the fire off. Police said that the fire appears to have been started due to a short circuit.

15.title: History has been created, a world of its own: Shanaya on 'Brahmāstra'
15.article_body: Actress Shanaya Kapoor took to Instagram Stories on Friday to appreciate Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt-starrer 'Brahmāstra: Part One – Shiva'. She wrote alongside a poster of Ranbir and Alia, "Ayan Mukerji, thank you for creating this experience. History has been created. A world of its own." The film also features Amitabh Bachchan, Dimple Kapadia, Mouni Roy and Nagarjuna.

16.title: Warden absconds after sexually abusing 7 minor boys in Hyderabad
16.article_body: A warden in a hostel of Sri Chaitanya school in Hyderabad is absconding after allegedly sexually assaulting about seven minor boys. According to police, 32-year-old Krishna allegedly used to sleep alongside the boys and would touch them inappropriately when they were asleep at night. The parents raised the issue with the management after which Krishna was removed from his job.

17.title: Senior ISIS militant captured in Turkey: Prez Erdogan
17.article_body: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan said that a senior member of the Islamic State militant group has been captured in Turkey. The operative, who's code-named Abu Zeyd, was captured in an operation carried out by police and Turkey's intelligence agency, who were monitoring his connections in Syria and Istanbul and had received intelligence that he'd enter Turkey illegally, Erdogan added.

18.title: Court realised hollowness of case: Journalist Kappan's wife on SC verdict
18.article_body: After Supreme Court granted bail to Kerala journalist Siddique Kappan, his wife Raihana expressed her happiness over the verdict. "We cannot explain the trauma we had gone through the last two years. Now...Supreme Court has realised...hollowness of the case," Raihanna said. Kappan was arrested in 2020 while on his way to Hathras to cover a Dalit girl's gangrape and murder.

19.title: What remains constant is gratitude I feel every b'day: Akshay Kumar
19.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar on Friday took to social media to share a picture of himself to thank fans for their wishes and love on his birthday. He wrote alongside the picture, "Years keep passing by, time keeps moving on. What remains constant is the gratitude I feel on every birthday. Thank you always for all your love."

20.title: Won't attend Filmfare Awards, I don't go to such shitty places: Vivek
20.article_body: Filmmaker Vivek Agnihotri revealed that he wasn't invited to Filmfare Awards this year. He added he'll not attend the award ceremony next year even if he gets an invite. "I don't go to such shitty places," he said, adding, "These awards [have]...become a fashion show, comprising star kids." Vivek further said he'll not become a part of the "corrupt system".

21.title: Allu Arjun's 'Pushpa: The Rise' inspires Ganpati Pandal in Maharashtra
21.article_body: A video has surfaced on social media which shows a Ganpati Pandal in Maharashtra using Allu Arjun-starrer 'Pushpa: The Rise' as a theme. The pandal was on the topic of Dahi Handi and the skit introduced characters talking in the style of characters from the film. The Ganesh idol was unveiled with a poster of Allu's character Pushpa.

22.title: Tamil Nadu man carries mother's body to crematorium in wheelchair
22.article_body: A 60-year-old man carried the body of his 84-year-old mother to a crematorium in a wheelchair in Tamil Nadu's Tiruchirapalli on Thursday. According to a crematorium official, Muruganandham said he felt no one would help him since his mother suffered from psoriasis, a skin disease. Muruganandham also said he had no money for the funeral, added the official.

23.title: India, China to complete disengagement in Gogra-Hot Springs by Sept 12: MEA
23.article_body: India and China will complete the disengagement process in the Gogra-Hot Springs area in eastern Ladakh by September 12, the Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) said. "The two sides have agreed to cease forward deployments in this area in a phased, coordinated...verified manner, resulting in the return of the troops of both sides to their respective areas," MEA added.

24.title: SC refuses to hear plea over arrest of Nupur Sharma for Prophet remarks
24.article_body: Supreme Court refused to hear a plea seeking the arrest of former BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma for her remarks on Prophet Mohammed. "Court should be circumspect while issuing directions. Our suggestion is, withdraw this," Chief Justice of India UU Lalit said. Sharma had earlier moved the SC seeking merging of cases against her for her remarks against the Prophet.

25.title: 11 lakh pilgrims visit Kedarnath Dham in 126 days, footfall breaks record
25.article_body: Breaking the previous record, 11 lakh pilgrims are reported to have visited the Kedarnath Dham in 126 days. "A record number of passengers have arrived on this visit. The Yatra was affected due to [COVID-19] for two years but this time the yatra is being conducted duly," District Magistrate (DM), Mayur Dixit, said.

26.title: Mumbai's BEST starts 'seat reservation' for airport bus services
26.article_body: Passengers can now book their seats on BEST's airport bus services before travelling from the Mumbai airport. One can use BEST's Chalo app to reserve their seats from September 9, an official said. The air-conditioned electric buses will ply from International Airport (T2) to various areas throughout the night. According to the official, these buses are a more cost-effective option.

27.title: Airline staffer mishears 'ballast' as 'blast', sparks security scare at Bhopal airport
27.article_body: An alert was sounded at Bhopal's Raja Bhoj International Airport on Thursday after an IndiGo employee misheard the word "ballast" as "blast" in an inquiry call. The caller inquired about a ballast (extra load used to balance aircraft weight) on a Hyderabad to Agra flight travelling via Bhopal. Passengers were made to deboard the flight and security systems were activated.

28.title: 8 tree-fall incidents recorded due to rain in Pune on Sept 7: PMC
28.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) tweeted on Thursday that eight tree-fall incidents were reported on September 7 as the city witnessed continuous rainfall. The civic body added that no one was injured in the incidents, however, two of the trees fell on four-wheelers and damaged the vehicles. Earlier, India Meteorological Department issued a 'yellow' alert for Pune till September 11.

29.title: Ganesh Visarjan begins in Hyderabad; pics emerge
29.article_body: Several Ganesh Visarjan (idol immersion) processions were taken out in Hyderabad on the tenth day of the Ganesh festival on Friday. Hyderabad Traffic Police shared visuals of the Bada Ganesh idol as the visarjan procession started in Khairatabad. It also shared pictures of the procession of Balapur Ganesh. Visuals of idol immersions at Tank Bund Road have also surfaced online.

30.title: This is the path of duty: Kangana on Rajpath being renamed Kartavya Path
30.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut attended the unveiling of Delhi's renovated Rajpath-Kartavya Path on Thursday. Speaking about the renaming, the actress said, "Many generations will lead by example and walk on it." She added, "If you keep the name Rajpath, it will not lead by example but the Kartavya Path is the path of duty, this will serve as guidance to people."

31.title: Delhi's Deen Dayal college holds part of professors' salaries citing lack of funds
31.article_body: Delhi government-funded Deen Dayal Upadhyaya College released only a part of professors' salaries for July, citing a lack of funds. It has retained ₹30,000 from the net salaries of assistant professors and ₹50,000 from those of associate professors/professors. "The same will be released as and when the funds are available," the officiating principal of the college stated in a notice.

32.title: Mumbai man forced to pay ₹5.28 lakh after woman records his intimate video
32.article_body: A 54-year-old man from Mumbai was forced to pay ₹5.28 lakh to blackmailers after a woman he befriended on Facebook told him to strip and recorded his intimate video. Reports said the woman had threatened the man to make his video viral. He also got a call from a fraudster posing as CBI official saying that the video was online.

33.title: Eiffel Tower, Empire State Building honour Queen Elizabeth II
33.article_body: The Eiffel Tower in Paris went dark on Thursday night in honour of late UK Queen Elizabeth II. The Empire State Building in New York was lit up in purple and silver to honour the life and legacy of the Queen. The Queen, Britain's longest-serving monarch, died at the age of 96 at Balmoral Castle in Scotland on Thursday.

34.title: Passenger vehicle sales rise 21% in Aug as chip supply improves
34.article_body: Passenger vehicle wholesales in India reported a 21% annual growth with 2,81,210 units dispatched to dealers in August as against 2,32,224 units in August last year, the Society of Indian Automobile Manufacturers (SIAM) data showed. This was driven by improved supplies of semiconductors and festive demand. Total two-wheeler wholesales also witnessed a 16% growth to 15,57,429 units last month.

35.title: Last photo of Queen Elizabeth II shows her at Balmoral Castle 2 days before her death
35.article_body: A final photograph of Queen Elizabeth II, who passed away aged 96, shows the monarch smiling and clutching a walking stick while standing next to a fireplace at the Balmoral Castle. The picture was clicked on Tuesday, two days before her death, when she officially appointed Liz Truss as the new UK PM. It was clicked by photographer Jane Barlow.

36.title: He adds another feather to his cap: Anurag on Neeraj Chopra's Diamond Trophy
36.article_body: After javelin thrower Neeraj Chopra became the first-ever Indian to win the Diamond League final,  Sports Minister Anurag Thakur took to Twitter and wrote, "Neeraj Chopra adds another feather to his cap." He added, "You've taken Indian Sports to new heights with your superb performances...Congratulations Champ!!" Neeraj threw 88.44 metres to win the Diamond Trophy in Zurich on Thursday.

37.title: US seizes $30 mn in crypto from N Korea-linked hackers: Chainalysis
37.article_body: US authorities have seized over $30 million in crypto stolen by North Korea-linked hackers Lazarus during Axie Infinity hack, blockchain analysis firm Chainalysis said. "This marks the first time ever that cryptocurrency stolen by a North Korean hacking group has been seized," it stated. Seizures represent around 10% of roughly $615 million in crypto stolen in the hack, it added.

38.title: Nobody would've survived so long: Gambhir on Kohli's ton after nearly 3 yrs
38.article_body: Gautam Gambhir said Virat Kohli should "realise" that he scored his 71st international hundred after nearly "three years" and not three months. "Three years is a very long time...Let's be fair, I don't think anyone would've survived for this long," added Gambhir. Kohli scored 122*(61) against Afghanistan to record the milestone, registering the highest individual T20I score by an Indian.

39.title: Romanian Navy ship with 75 onboard hit by drifting mine in Black Sea
39.article_body: A Romanian Navy dredger was hit by a drifting mine it was trying to defuse in bad weather on Thursday in the Black Sea, the country's Defence Ministry said. The 75 crew members onboard the ship were unharmed following the explosion, the ministry added. Mines began floating in the Black Sea after Russia invaded Ukraine on February 24.

40.title: Amid Ganesh Visarjan, IMD issues yellow alert in Pune till September 11
40.article_body: India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued a yellow alert in Pune till September 11. The district is expected to see heavy rain, thunder, lightning and gusty winds, IMD said. District administration has advised people to stay indoors during thunderstorms and lightning amid Ganesh Visarjan. It has also urged them not to hide beneath trees and stay away from electric poles.

41.title: Singapore's Whampoa Group to invest $100 mn via fund for digital assets
41.article_body: Singapore's Whampoa Group is looking to invest $100 million through a venture capital fund in startups in the digital assets segment, its executives told Reuters. Whampoa's digital assets investment arm, Whampoa Digital, will invest in equity and tokens of products or services and incubate early-stage startups in Web3. Whampoa is a multi-family office with investments in global tech firms.

42.title: Proud to be part of historic work: 'Kartavya Path' worker after meeting PM
42.article_body: Neeraj Kumar, one of the 16 workers who were part of the Central Vista Avenue redevelopment, said, "With...redevelopment of the entire stretch, I've also become...part of this historic work." "People will come here and see my work forever. I feel proud to have been a part of it," the 25-year-old worker from Bihar said after meeting PM Narendra Modi.

43.title: North Korea passes law allowing it to carry out nuclear attack if threatened
43.article_body: North Korea has passed a law allowing it to carry out a preemptive nuclear attack to protect itself. With the new law, "the status of our country as a nuclear weapons state has become irreversible", leader Kim Jong-un said. Kim in July said his country was "ready to mobilise" its nuclear capability in any war with US and South Korea.

44.title: Akshay had jumped to save person who put his feet on open electric cable: Vipul
44.article_body: Filmmaker Vipul Shah said that actor Akshay Kumar had once, without thinking of his own safety, jumped to save a person who had put his feet on an open electric cable. "There was a risk of being electrocuted, but he just pulled the person out of the situation," he said, adding that Akshay looks after his crew.

45.title: Whether I'll become Congress Prez or not will be clear after party polls: Rahul
45.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi during a media conference amid the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' on Friday said that whether he will become the party President or not will become clear when the party conducts the election. He added that he has made his decision about if he will contest the party's election or not and that there is "no confusion".

46.title: Hyd's 21-kg Balapur laddu auctioned for ₹24.6 lakh during Ganesh Chaturthi
46.article_body: The 21-kg famous laddu of Balapur in Hyderabad was auctioned for ₹24.6 lakh on Friday morning during the Ganesh Chaturthi festivities in Telangana. The auction was won by Vengeti Laxma Reddy of VLR builders. Reports said that this was the 29th year of holding an auction of the laddu. In 1994, the laddu was reportedly auctioned for ₹450.

47.title: 'The Crown' is a love letter to Queen Elizabeth II: Show's writer
47.article_body: 'The Crown' writer Peter Morgan has stated that the Emmy-winning drama series is a "love letter" to Queen Elizabeth II. The Queen, who was Britain's longest-serving monarch, passed away on Thursday at the age of 96. Peter further said, "I've nothing to add for now, just silence and respect. I expect we will stop filming out of respect too."

48.title: Los Angeles declares September 17 as 'Squid Game' Day
48.article_body: Los Angeles has officially designated September 17 as 'Squid Game' Day to commemorate the influence of the Korean drama series on American pop culture. The resolution passed by the city council states the series made history "by becoming the first Korean and first foreign language series to be nominated at the Screen Actors Guild Awards [and] bringing home three wins".

49.title: PMC to construct another bridge on Mutha river at a cost of ₹45 cr
49.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) will construct one more bridge on the Mutha river to connect the Sinhagad Road to Karvenagar as proposed in the Development Plan of the city, a PMC official said. The project, which is estimated to cost ₹45 crore, will divert a lot of traffic from the main Sinhagad Road, the official added.

50.title: Improve hospitals for treatment of burn victims: NCW asks J'khand govt
50.article_body: The National Commission for Women (NCW) has directed the Jharkhand government to "improve hospital infrastructure" for the treatment of burn victims. This comes after a fact-finding committee visited the state to investigate a 15-year-old girl's death who was set ablaze by her stalker. The committee found two hospitals, where the victim was taken for treatment, to be lacking basic infrastructure.

51.title: I got wickets wherever I was bowling: Bhuvneshwar Kumar on his 5/4
51.article_body: Having recorded his career-best figures of 4-1-4-5 in the Asia Cup match against Afghanistan, India pacer Bhuvneshwar Kumar said he was able to pick wickets "wherever" he bowled. "It was my day...The white-ball [usually] doesn't swing much but it...swung a lot today," added Bhuvneshwar. Bhuvneshwar broke the record for picking the most wickets for India in T20Is, overtaking Yuzvendra Chahal.

52.title: IIT Delhi launches app to enable city people to report flooding in real time
52.article_body: IIT Delhi has launched a mobile application to enable the residents of the national capital to report flooding in real time. Reports said that this will help researchers in developing an early warning system to predict urban floods. The app, called IITD Aab Prahari, has been developed as part of the Civil Engineering Department's Water Security Hub project.

53.title: India declares 1-day state mourning on Sept 11 over Queen Elizabeth II's demise
53.article_body: The Centre on Friday announced that one-day state mourning will be observed throughout India on September 11 "as a mark of respect on the passing away of Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II, United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland". On Sunday, the Tricolour will be flown at half mast on all buildings where the National Flag is flown regularly.

54.title: Ananya is very dear to me & will always remain so: Ishaan on breakup
54.article_body: Actor Ishaan Khatter spoke about his breakup with actress Ananya Panday during his appearance on celebrity talk show 'Koffee with Karan'. He said, "She is one of the most wonderful people I have known...Anyone who has met her would say this...And all pulpy questions aside, she is someone who is very dear to me and will always remain so."

55.title: Delhi Police conducts raids in 22 cities, busts cyber fraud gang; 65 held
55.article_body: Delhi Police busted a cyber fraud gang and arrested 65 people who allegedly cheated people on the pretext of updating the BSES electricity bill. The arrests were made after the police conducted raids in 22 cities across the country over 10 days. The police said that NCRP had received over 200 complaints and over 500 instances of cheating were noticed.

56.title: Election petitions should ideally be disposed of in 6 months: K'taka HC
56.article_body: Election petitions should ideally be disposed of within six months, Karnataka High Court has said. The court was hearing a petition filed in 2018 by Muniraju Gowda, who as the BJP candidate, lost the Assembly elections to the then Congress candidate Munirathna Naidu, who is now a minister in the BJP government. Gowda had filed the petition seeking Naidu's disqualification.

57.title: Allu Arjun backs out of 'Icon' over story, upcoming lineups: Report
57.article_body: Actor Allu Arjun, who was expected to begin shooting for Venu Sriram's 'Icon', has backed out of the film due to the story and his upcoming lineups, reported Pinkvilla. This was going to be his first collaboration with Sriram. The report added Sriram has pitched a script to actor Ram Pothineni but there is no confirmation if it is 'Icon'.

58.title: US woman throws dead racoon at abortion clinic, attacks police; held
58.article_body: A US woman has been arrested for allegedly attacking police officers after throwing a dead racoon at an Ohio abortion clinic. The woman also allegedly threw eggs at volunteer escorts, who shielded themselves with umbrellas. Attacks against abortion clinic workers and volunteers have reportedly risen following US Supreme Court's decision in June to overturn a ruling which legalised abortion.

59.title: SC grants bail to Kerala journalist Kappan arrested by UP govt in 2020 under UAPA
59.article_body: Supreme Court has granted bail to Kerala journalist Siddique Kappan who was arrested by UP government under the Unlawful Activities Prevention Act (UAPA). Kappan was arrested in 2020 while he was on his way to Hathras where a Dalit woman had died after allegedly being gang-raped. Kappan will be released after being produced before the trial court in three days.

60.title: You are my most favourite co-star: Kareena on Akshay's birthday
60.article_body: Actress Kareena Kapoor took to Instagram Stories on Friday to share a picture with actor Akshay Kumar on his birthday. She wrote alongside the picture, "Happy Birthday Akshay. You are and always will be my most favourite co-star ('cause I get to pack up at 3 pm)." They starred together in 'Ajnabee', 'Aitraaz', 'Kambakkht Ishq' and 'Good Newwz' among others.

61.title: Rahul Gandhi drinks coconut water during Bharat Jodo Yatra, video surfaces
61.article_body: A video of Congress leader Rahul Gandhi drinking coconut water during 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' has surfaced online. In the video, a man can be seen giving coconut water to Gandhi, following which, he and Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel can be seen having it. Meanwhile, a picture of Congress leader KC Venugopal resting on a bench has also surfaced online.

62.title: Indian-American leader called 'fu***** c***', told to 'go back' in audio shared by her
62.article_body: Indian-American Congresswoman Pramila Jayapal has shared an audio compilation of the abusive threat calls received by her and wrote, "We cannot accept violence as our new norm." In the audio, a man can be heard saying, "You stupid fu***** c***. Get ready for turmoil." "Why don't you guys go back to where you fu***** came from," said another man.

63.title: Kohinoor Crown to go to King Charles' wife Camilla: Report
63.article_body: Queen Elizabeth II, who passed away at the age of 96, had announced that Prince Charles' wife Camilla would become Queen Consort when he accedes to the throne. When this happens, Camilla will receive Queen Mother's famous Kohinoor crown, according to a Daily Mail report. The last Queen Consort was Queen Elizabeth II's mother, who became known as Queen Mother.

64.title: People taking me seriously as actor after 'JugJugg Jeeyo': Maniesh Paul
64.article_body: Actor Maniesh Paul stated in an interview that people have started taking him seriously as an actor after 'JugJugg Jeeyo'. He added that earlier people thought he will only do hosting. "A lot of films are released but people don't necessarily watch them. They came to watch this film and they liked my work so I am thrilled," he said.

65.title: Salman Khan has taught me to keep moving ahead: Shehnaaz Gill
65.article_body: Actress Shehnaaz Gill stated in an interview that she has learnt to keep moving ahead from actor Salman Khan, adding that he motivates her a lot. "He has told me that I can go really far in life if I work hard," the actress added. She will make her Bollywood debut in Salman's 'Kisi Ka Bhai Kisi Ki Jaan'.

66.title: Facilities at campsites basic; BJP trying to 'defame' yatra: Congress
66.article_body: Congress on Friday said its 'Bharat Yatris' were staying in containers which have very "basic and minimal" facilities. The party claimed that BJP was trying to "defame" the yatra by spreading falsehoods about the facilities at its campsites. "This is not like...Rath Yatra. It's not a Toyota Yatra or an Innova Yatra. Ours is...Padyatra," Congress leader Jairam Ramesh said.

67.title: Net inflows to equity mutual funds fall to 10-month low of ₹5,942 cr in Aug
67.article_body: Net inflows to equity-oriented mutual funds fell to a 10-month low of ₹5,942 crore in August as against ₹8,882.6 crore in the previous month, the Association of Mutual Funds in India (AMFI) data showed. The data also showed that the total debt scheme clocked ₹49,164 crore worth of inflows in August, while hybrid funds clocked an outflow of ₹6,600 crore.

68.title: Naughty boys of Koffee club should focus on films: Vivek Agnihotri
68.article_body: Filmmaker Vivek Agnihotri on Thursday indirectly reacted to an old video of him saying he eats beef. He wrote on Twitter, "I think the naughty boys of Koffee club should ask their SM agencies and PR firms to focus on their film rather than fighting the battle with me. I'm not the kind whom you can break with free hampers."

69.title: You've rested enough: Gambhir on Rohit being rested vs Afghanistan
69.article_body: Talking about Rohit Sharma being rested for the match against Afghanistan, Gautam Gambhir said, "You cannot be resting, you've...rested enough." "Rohit should...[play] every game from here on looking at the T20 World Cup," added Gambhir. Sharing his opinion on Virat Kohli scoring his first international hundred after nearly three years, Gambhir stated, "[Nobody] would've survived...this long."

70.title: Dogs around MP zoo given anti-rabies vaccine before arrival of cheetahs
70.article_body: Ahead of the arrival of cheetahs in Madhya Pradesh's Kuno National Park, over 1,000 dogs around the zoo have been administered the anti-rabies vaccine, an official said. The cheetahs, that are from Africa, will arrive at the zoo as part of India's project to reintroduce the animal. This was done to protect the cheetahs from rabies, the official added.

71.title: 102-yr-old man declared 'dead' dresses up as groom to prove he's alive in Haryana
71.article_body: A 102-year-old man staged a protest and dressed up like a groom to prove he's alive, claiming that his pension was stopped earlier this year on the ground that he was dead. Duli Chand undertook a procession to hand over a memorandum to officials, urging them to restore his pension. He also held a 'Your uncle is still alive' board.

72.title: Arunachal Assembly adopts Transplantation of Human Organ Act
72.article_body: Arunachal Pradesh Assembly on Thursday unanimously adopted the Transplantation of Human Organ Act, 1994 (Amendment Act 2011). "Adoption of this Act will be our first step towards creating suitable infrastructure for implementation, capacity building of hospital staff and doctors, advocacy for promoting deceased organ and tissue donation," Arunachal Health Minister Alo Libang said.

73.title: Winter is going to be hard on the battlefield in Ukraine: NATO chief
73.article_body: NATO Secretary-General Jens Stoltenberg warned that "winter is going to be hard on the battlefield in Ukraine" as "there's no sign of Russia giving up its goal of taking control of Ukraine". Stoltenberg said Ukraine is in urgent need of winter essentials as "the size of...Ukrainian army is now roughly three times as big as what it was last winter".

74.title: 4 trekkers from West Bengal missing in Kullu since Wednesday
74.article_body: Four trekkers from West Bengal have gone missing in Himachal Pradesh's Kullu district since Wednesday, said officials on Friday. They were trekking to Mount Ali Ratni Tibba. A cook and two others, who were part of the expedition, informed authorities about the missing men after returning to Wachem near Malana village, according to the State Disaster Management Authority (SDMA).

75.title: Kolkata-based Wow! Momo raises ₹125 cr from OAKS Asset Management
75.article_body: Kolkata-headquartered Wow! Momo raised around ₹125 crore from OAKS Asset Management at a valuation of ₹2,125 crore in its Series D round of funding. The company is set to raise another ₹100 crore from another venture capital fund in the next quarter, it said. Backed by Tiger Global, Wow! Momo was founded by Binod Homagai and Sagar Daryani in 2008.

76.title: PNC Infratech stock rises 3% after firm bags ₹1,458-cr NHAI project
76.article_body: After PNC Infratech said that it had signed an agreement with the National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) for a ₹1,458-crore project, its stock rose by nearly 3% to ₹294.95 apiece on BSE on Friday. PNC said it will work on the Sonauli-Gorakhpur section of NH-29E in Uttar Pradesh. At 11:45 am, its shares were trading at ₹294.05 on BSE.

77.title: Pic of 'bored' 4-year-old Charles at his mother Elizabeth II's coronation resurfaces
77.article_body: A picture showing 4-year-old Charles at Elizabeth II's coronation has resurfaced as he becomes the King after the demise of his mother. Commenting on the picture which was shared by the Royal Collection Trust on Instagram in 2019, a user wrote, "The kid's bored." In the picture, Charles is standing between his grandmother, and aunt Princess Margaret.

78.title: Gujarat Congress calls for bandh over jobs, inflation on Saturday
78.article_body: Gujarat Congress has called for a bandh in the state over inflation and unemployment on Saturday. The party appealed to traders and businesses to keep their shops closed from 8 am to 12 noon. Party's state chief Jagdish Thakor claimed that there are over 4.5 lakh registered unemployed youths in the state, while lakhs of government posts remain vacant.

79.title: Delhi govt begins prep for spraying decomposer to curb stubble burning
79.article_body: The Delhi government has started preparing to spray bio-decomposer on farmland to prevent stubble burning, said Delhi Environment Minister Gopal Rai. The decomposer will be sprayed free of cost on all basmati and non-basmati paddy fields in the city, Rai added. Last year, the government received applications for spraying the decomposer on around 4,300 acres of paddy fields in Delhi.

80.title: Tata Group in talks with Taiwanese supplier for JV to assemble iPhones in India: Report
80.article_body: Tata Group is in talks with Taiwanese supplier Wistron to establish a joint venture to assemble Apple's iPhones in India, Bloomberg reported. Apple began iPhone assembly in India in 2017 via Wistron and later with Foxconn. The plan could result in Tata Group buying equity in Wistron's India operations or two companies building a new assembly plant, the report added.

81.title: King Charles to now travel without passport, drive without licence, have 2 birthdays
81.article_body: UK's new king Charles III can travel without a passport and drive without a licence. As his birthday is on November 14, it's likely he'll have an 'official birthday' in a warmer month. He would also own all unmarked mute swans in England. He can grant Royal Warrants to companies/tradespeople. Burberry, Cadbury, Jaguar Cars are among companies with Royal Warrants.

82.title: Andhra Pradesh CM orders action against money lending apps after couple's suicide
82.article_body: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister YS Jagan Mohan Reddy has ordered for stringent action to be taken against online money lending apps for harassment of users. This comes after a city couple died by suicide following harassment by loan application agents. The Chief Minister also directed East Godavari district collector to provide financial assistance of ₹5 lakh each to victims' children.

83.title: Woman develops complications after family planning operation in Hyd, dies
83.article_body: A woman died after allegedly developing complications after undergoing a family planning operation in Hyderabad. Reports said that the woman passed away while undergoing treatment. However, reports added that the exact reason for the woman's death is not yet known and that the officials from the hospital have not issued any statement as of now.

84.title: Van falls into 120-ft-deep well in TN; 3 college students killed
84.article_body: Three college students were killed after a van they were travelling in plunged into a 120-foot-deep well in Tamil Nadu's Coimbatore on Friday, police said. According to the police, the well had over 80 feet of water and the college students drowned. The van's driver, who sustained injuries, was driving the vehicle in a rash and negligent manner, police added.

85.title: 25-year-old homeless woman gangraped by 3 near Gorakhpur station
85.article_body: A 25-year-old homeless woman was allegedly kidnapped and gangraped by three youths near Gorakhpur railway station in Uttar Pradesh, police said on Thursday. The victim was admitted to BRD Medical College after she reported the incident to the police, said SP (Railway) Awdhesh Singh. The suspects beat her and fled when she tried to raise an alarm, he added.

86.title: Bihar man jailed for wife's murder, police find her alive at dad's Nepal home
86.article_body: The wife of a man who was allegedly sent to jail for her murder in Bihar, was found alive and well at her maternal home in Nepal. Reports said that the woman's parents had accused her husband and her in-laws of burning their daughter alive. The police had launched an investigation even though the woman's husband had been jailed.

87.title: Had promising talks with Apple about Starlink: Musk on iPhone 14 SOS feature
87.article_body: SpaceX CEO Elon Musk on Thursday said the company had "promising conversations" with Apple regarding Starlink connectivity for iPhone 14's new satellite-powered SOS feature. "For sure, closing link from space to phone will work best if phone software and hardware adapt to space-based signals vs Starlink purely emulating cell tower," he added. Apple chose Globalstar's services to power the feature.

88.title: Pune's PCMC receives 69,032 applications for 386 permanent posts
88.article_body: Pune's Pimpri-Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC) has received 69,032 job applications for 386 permanent posts. "The last date for applying is till 6 pm September 8," an official earlier said. Notably, recruitment for the posts is being carried out after nearly seven years. As many as 22,000 have applied for the 213 clerical posts and 21,000 for junior engineers posts.

89.title: Over 8,000 policemen to patrol Pune roads for Ganesh idol immersions today
89.article_body: More than 8,000 policemen will be patrolling Pune streets today for Ganesh idol immersions on the occasion of Anant Chaturdashi, an official said. Pune Police Commissioner Amitabh Gupta said CCTVs had been installed at various spots in the city. "Nearly 3,000 registered Ganesh pandals will carry out immersions. They will be allowed to play music only till midnight," he added.

90.title: 5 killed, 11 injured after jeep collides with truck in Rajasthan
90.article_body: Five people, including a child, died and 11 others were injured after the jeep they were travelling in collided with a truck in Rajasthan's Nagaur district on Thursday night. According to Circle Officer Jayal Rameshwar Lal, the accident occurred when the jeep was going to Sikar from Ramdevra temple in Jaisalmer. All passengers were residents of Ringas, Lal added.

91.title: OTT has horrible culture, takes months to get back: Prakash Jha
91.article_body: Filmmaker Prakash Jha has stated that OTT platforms have a horrible culture, adding that they take months to get back. "They say your film is a dry film, it is artsy and takes months to get back, sometimes not with positive answers," he added. The filmmaker further said the audience has a choice now and rejects films that aren't good.

92.title: All rumours are fake: Charmme on reports of Vijay's 'Jana...' being shelved
92.article_body: Actress-producer Charmme Kaur has addressed the reports of Vijay Deverakonda's 'Jana Gana Mana' being shelved after the box office failure of 'Liger'. She wrote on Twitter, "Rumours rumours rumours! All rumours are fake! Just focusing on the progress of Puri Connects. Meanwhile, RIP rumours!!" 'Jana Gana Mana' will feature Vijay as an army officer and co-stars Pooja Hegde.

93.title: Pic of elderly fan bowing down to Kohli moments after his 71st int'l hundred goes viral
93.article_body: A picture of an elderly fan bowing down to Virat Kohli from the stands just moments after his 71st international hundred has gone viral on social media. "Only Virat Kohli can make a man more than twice his age bow down to him," a fan tweeted. "This pic goes hard and deep!" wrote another. Kohli slammed 122*(61) against Afghanistan.

94.title: Congress fired missiles, I only retaliated with 303 rifle: Azad
94.article_body: Ghulam Nabi Azad, who recently resigned from the Congress, has criticised the party saying that they "fired missiles" on him but he only retaliated with a "303 rifle" and they were destroyed. "What would have happened had I used a ballistic missile?" he added. Earlier, Azad had said that he will launch a new party soon.

95.title: Inquiry ordered: Shinde on 'beautification' of terrorist Yakub's grave
95.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Thursday said that an inquiry has been ordered over the alleged beautification of terrorist Yakub Memon's grave. "Strict action will be taken against...persons responsible," he added. Earlier, BJP claimed that the previous state government under former CM Uddhav Thackeray was responsible. Memon was convicted in the 1993 Mumbai blasts case and was hanged in 2015.

96.title: BMC to renovate Mumbai's iconic Worli Fort, black basalt stone bought
96.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) will be giving the iconic Worli Fort a makeover, reports said. The civic body has also purchased black basalt stone for the renovation process. "We have just started work on the project...We will also illuminate it at night so that it becomes visible from the sea link," an official said.

97.title: UN chief arrives in flood-hit Pakistan, appeals for 'massive' help
97.article_body: UN Secretary-General António Guterres appealed to the world for "massive help" for flood-hit Pakistan as he arrived in the South Asian country on Friday for a two-day visit. The UN has launched an appeal for $160 million in aid to help Pakistan cope with the disaster, which has been blamed on climate change. The floods have killed over 1,390 people.

98.title: What multiple records did Virat Kohli break with his 71st international hundred?
98.article_body: Virat Kohli slammed 122*(61) against Afghanistan, his 71st international hundred. It's the highest individual T20I score by an Indian and the highest individual T20I score on UAE soil. It's also the first-ever hundred by a player in T20 Asia Cup. Kohli also became the fastest batter to reach 3,500 T20I runs (96 innings) and 24,000 international runs (522 innings).

99.title: Cricket looked incomplete without Virat Kohli scoring runs: Pakistan's Wahab Riaz
99.article_body: After Virat Kohli smashed his first international hundred after nearly three years, Pakistan's Wahab Riaz tweeted, "Cricket looked incomplete without Kohli scoring runs." He added, "Good to see the run machine back. Enjoyed the Kohli show." Kohli scored 122*(61) against Afghanistan on Thursday, his first T20I hundred. Kohli has now slammed hundreds against 10 nations in international cricket.

100.title: Who have been the world's longest serving monarchs?
100.article_body: Queen Elizabeth II who passed away aged 96 is second on the list of world's longest serving monarchs. Louis XIV of France who reigned for over 72 years is at the top. Queen overtook Thailand's King Bhumibol Adulyadej, who is third on the list, in June this year. Austrian Emperor Franz Joseph, who reigned for nearly 68 years, is fourth.

101.title: Harsha Engineers sets price band at ₹314-330 apiece for Sept 14 IPO
101.article_body: Harsha Engineers International has set a price band of ₹314-₹330 a share for its initial public offering (IPO) that will open for subscription on September 14 and close on September 16. The anchor book will open on September 13. The IPO comprises fresh issue of ₹455 crore and offer for sale of up to ₹300 crore by shareholders and promoters.

102.title: Have they lost their minds? I was so angry: Miandad on Afghanistan
102.article_body: Discussing the behaviour of the Afghanistan cricketers in their match against Pakistan, ex-Pakistan captain Javed Miandad said, "Do they consider themselves bigger? They haven't even started playing cricket. Have they lost their minds?" "I was so angry...with the way they were behaving," added Miandad. "They have learnt from us. I have personally given them coaching," he stated.

103.title: Demolition of Goa's Curlies, linked to death of Sonali Phogat, put on hold by SC
103.article_body: The Supreme Court on Friday stayed the demolition of Goa's Curlies shack subject to the condition that no commercial activities will take place there. It was being razed for allegedly flouting the coastal zone regulations. This comes days after BJP leader and TikTok star Sonali Phogat was allegedly drugged at a party in Curlies hours before her death.

104.title: What is the British Royal family's new line of succession after Queen's death?
104.article_body: With the passing of Queen Elizabeth, her son Charles accedes to the throne and becomes King, creating a shift in the line of succession underneath him. Once second in line to the throne, Charles' elder son William is now the heir to the throne. William's son George, is now second in line and his daughter Charlotte is third in line.

105.title: UP govt offers to bear patient's treatment cost after son appeals to Dy CM
105.article_body: Kaushambi district administration has offered to bear the treatment expenses of the father of an 11-year-old boy after the latter appealed to UP Deputy CM Keshav Prasad Maurya. "The officials of the district hospital have been asked to submit an estimate of his treatment which will be sent to the office of the Deputy CM," Kaushambi DM Sujeet Kumar said.

106.title: Punjab policeman misbehaves as man refuses to give him ride, transferred
106.article_body: A policeman deployed in Ludhiana Civil Hospital was transferred after he allegedly misbehaved with a city resident. Reports said the policeman allegedly asked the resident for ride to a spot near Clock Tower. The resident said he was in a hurry and refused to drive him. Police said the policeman was heavily drunk, as found by doctors during medical checkup.

107.title: End of an era: Riteish, Sushmita, Anushka on Queen Elizabeth's demise
107.article_body: Bollywood celebrities like Riteish Deshmukh, Sushmita Sen, Anushka Sharma and Kareena Kapoor took to social media to condole the demise of Queen Elizabeth II. Riteish tweeted, "End of an era!! Through the toughest times she never let [go] of her dignity." Sushmita shared a picture of her, writing, "What an incredible & truly celebrated life...The very embodiment of QUEEN!!!"

108.title: Everyone wants me to run again for US President in 2024: Trump
108.article_body: Former US President Donald Trump said that everyone wants him to run again for President in 2024, adding that he is "leading in the polls". "I'll make a decision in the very near future, I suspect...And I think...a lot of people will be [happy] and a couple of people will be unhappy," Trump told NDTV in an interview.

109.title: EU to introduce cybersecurity rules for smart devices: Report
109.article_body: With mounting concerns about cybersecurity attacks, the European Commission will reportedly announce its proposal for smart devices like TVs and refrigerators which are connected to internet to comply with European Union's cybersecurity rules. The Cyber Resilience Act is likely to become law after input from EU countries. Those companies which don't comply could be fined or banned from the bloc.

110.title: Thankful you're my bestest friend: Shilpa pens note on Raj Kundra's b'day
110.article_body: Actress Shilpa Shetty on Friday took to Instagram to share a video montage of Raj Kundra to mark his birthday. She wrote in the caption, "I'm thankful that you're my bestest friend, the father of my children, my love and my strength. Happy birthday, my Cookie." Raj has been released on bail over a pornography films case.

111.title: Can we stop with ageist headlines, comments: Leonardo's ex-girlfriend
111.article_body: Actor Leonardo DiCaprio's ex-girlfriend Kristen Zang wrote an op-ed for People Magazine criticising the "ageist headlines and comments" against his ex-girlfriends. Kristen wrote, "I read...headlines and...comments with his most recent ex-girlfriend being..."aged out" or being "too old for Leo at 25"...I think we can and should do better...But let's keep the funny memes coming, they're stellar."

112.title: 3 people killed, 3 injured as car falls into gorge in Rishikesh
112.article_body: Three people were killed and as many were injured after the car they were travelling in fell into a gorge near Brahmapuri on the Rishikesh-Badrinath road on Friday, said police. They were on their way to the Badrinath Dham, according to a police official. The injured persons were rescued and taken to a government hospital in Rishikesh.

113.title: UP govt to create 300-km long immune belt to check spread of lumpy virus
113.article_body: To check the spread of the lumpy virus disease, the Uttar Pradesh government has decided to create a 300-km long "immune belt" from Pilibhit to Etawah. The "immune belt" will pass through 23 blocks of five districts and will be 10 km wide. The Animal Husbandry Department has completed preparations regarding the same.

114.title: KRK's son claims his father is being tortured, says 'sister & I will die without him'
114.article_body: Days after Kamaal Rashid Khan (KRK) was arrested in Mumbai, his 23-year-old son Faisal tweeted that some people are "torturing to kill" his father. Requesting Abhishek Bachchan, Riteish Deshmukh and Devendra Fadnavis for help, he said, "I am just 23 years old living in London. I don't know how to help my father...Me n my sister will die without him."

115.title: Alia has become a trade analyst: Ranbir on 'Brahmāstra' advance bookings
115.article_body: On being asked about the advance bookings of 'Brahmāstra', actor Ranbir Kapoor stated that his wife actress Alia Bhatt is the most excited. "She is a trade analyst now. She is noting everything, this much is open here, this is the response there," he added. Ranbir further said they cannot take the figures seriously until the audience watches the film.

116.title: Iga Świątek becomes the 1st Polish woman to reach US Open final
116.article_body: World number one Iga Świątek became the first Polish woman to reach the US Open final, after defeating 2021 semi-finalist Aryna Sabalenka 3-6, 6-1, 6-4 in the semi-finals. "She was really aggressive on the second serve. She was putting pressure," said Świątek. "Honestly, I wasn't expecting too much from myself because Aryna is a great server," she added.

117.title: Noida Police bans private drones during World Dairy Summit
117.article_body: The Gautam Buddha Nagar Police on Thursday passed an order banning the operation of drones by private individuals and organisations till September 15 across Noida and Greater Noida. The ban has been ordered in view of the World Dairy Summit scheduled to begin in Greater Noida on September 12. Notably, PM Narendra Modi is expected to inaugurate the summit.

118.title: Electric scooter owner fined over pollution certificate in Kerala; challan pic viral
118.article_body: An electric scooter owner was fined by the Kerala Traffic Police for not having a valid Pollution Under Control (PUC) certificate. The photos of the vehicle and the e-challan issued by the police went viral on social media platforms. Social media users have appealed to Union Transport Minister Nitin Gadkari to look into the issue.

119.title: They're superstars, I was nervous: Siddhant on working with Deepika, Katrina
119.article_body: Speaking about working with actresses Deepika Padukone and Katrina Kaif, actor Siddhant Chaturvedi said that they are two distinct superstars. "For me, every film is a first film, I have worked with Ranveer and Alia in my first and then Deepika and Katrina," he said. The actor further said that he was very nervous to work with Katrina at first.

120.title: TMC workers can crush hands if BJP workers point finger: Kalyan Banerjee
120.article_body: TMC leader Kalyan Banerjee said if anyone from the BJP points a finger at anyone from TMC, the TMC workers can "crush those hands". "Didi (Mamata Banerjee) asked me to remain calm; that is why we have maintained a peaceful atmosphere. But if a BJP leader or a worker...threatens to break our hands...TMC workers can crush those hands," he added.

121.title: India slips 2 places on HDI, stays ahead of Pak but behind B'desh
121.article_body: India slipped two places on the Human Development Index (HDI) in a year, from 130 in 2020 to 132 in 2021, according to a UNDP report released on Thursday. India's HDI value stood at 0.633 during 2021. It stayed ahead of Pakistan, which was ranked 161st, but trailed Bangladesh, which stood on the 129th position.

122.title: World leaders pay tribute to UK's Queen Elizabeth II
122.article_body: World leaders paid tribute to UK's Queen Elizabeth II, who died on Thursday. French President Emmanuel Macron called her "a kind-hearted Queen" who was "a friend of France". Canadian PM Justin Trudeau said Queen was one of his favourite people in the world. She had been a "wise and enduring presence" in Australia's national life, Australian PM Anthony Albanese said.

123.title: 4-storey building collapses in Delhi's Azad market, 4 injured
123.article_body: As many as four persons were injured after a four-storey building collapsed in Delhi's Azad market area on Friday morning. No casualties have been reported till now, DCP (North) Sagar Singh Kalsi said. At least five persons are trapped under debris at the building collapse site, the Fire Department said earlier. The rescue operation is underway, it added.

124.title: Video shows Goa's Curlies being demolished days after Sonali Phogat was drugged there
124.article_body: A video showing the Curlies shack in Goa's Anjuna being demolished for allegedly flouting the coastal zone regulations has surfaced online. The video shows bulldozers and workers taking down the structure. The order for demolition came days after BJP leader and TikTok star Sonali Phogat was allegedly drugged at a party in Curlies hours before her death.

125.title: 102-yr-old man declared 'dead', dresses as groom to meet officials in Haryana
125.article_body: A 102-year-old man dressed up as a groom and took out a wedding procession to meet officials to prove that he is alive in Haryana's Rohtak after he was allegedly declared dead in government records and his old-age pension was stopped. One of the placards the man's supporters carried read- "Thara fufa abhi zinda hai (your uncle is still alive)".

126.title: Central Vista Avenue to have 4,000+ trees, heritage Jamun trees preserved
126.article_body: The revamped Central Vista Avenue will have over 4,000 different trees, reports said, adding that heritage Jamun trees have been preserved. Officials of the Central Public Works Department said that the Central Vista Avenue earlier had 3,890 trees and with new additions, the number now stands at 4,008. Officials added that 47 trees were transplanted within premises and 22 outside.

127.title: New batch for IIM I’s IPBA program starts on September 24: UNext Jigsaw
127.article_body: UNext Jigsaw shared that IIM Indore's 14th batch of online Integrated Program in Business Analytics (IPBA) will commence on September 24 covering in-demand subjects with 10+ graded assignments, industry-relevant case studies & capstone projects where students can gain access to an alumni network of 7000 professionals. 83% of IPBA students have achieved an average salary hike of 48%, it said.

128.title: 24,000 policemen, 739 extra CCTVs in Hyd to monitor Ganesh Visarjan
128.article_body: Over 24,000 police personnel and 122 platoons of reserve police have been deployed in Hyderabad as part of the security arrangements for Ganesh idol immersions on Friday and Saturday. As many as 739 additional CCTV cameras have been installed to monitor the routes through which the main procession will pass. Ten drone cameras are also being used.

129.title: Markets open in green with Sensex above 60,000, Nifty at 17,900
129.article_body: Benchmark indices opened in the green on Friday with Sensex rising 345.55 points to 60,033.77 and Nifty at 17,902.80, up by 104 points. IndusInd Bank, ICICI Bank, SBI, HUL and Tata Steel were among the major gainers. All sectoral indices opened at a high with Nifty Bank and Nifty Metal topping the charts.

130.title: realme announces offers worth ₹700 crore for realme Festive Day sale
130.article_body: realme announced the realme Festive Days sale with offers worth ₹700 crore, including up to ₹15,000 discount on smartphones and up to ₹12,000 discount on AIoT products. Users can avail discounts through realme.com, Flipkart, Amazon, & mainline stores. It also introduced the realme Savings Pass, redeemable after the sale goes live for benefits worth ₹1000, plus additional benefits.

131.title: Congress broke India, BJP unifying it: Biren Singh on 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'
131.article_body: While commenting upon Congress' 'Bharat Jodo Yatra', Manipur CM N Biren Singh alleged that the party broke India and BJP is unifying it. "If they (Congress) had removed Article 370 from Jammu and Kashmir...people would have believed that they want to unite India. But it was abrogated by...BJP," Singh added. Congress launched the yatra from Kanniyakumari on September 7.

132.title: Andhra couple kills self after harassment over loan, call cousin before death
132.article_body: A couple from Andhra Pradesh allegedly died by suicide on their daughter's birthday after being harassed over the repayment of a loan, reports said. The woman also called her cousin minutes before ending her life to request him to take care of their children. The loan application officials allegedly threatened to post the woman's morphed pictures online.

133.title: 3 get life term for burning alive Nashik additional district collector in 2011
133.article_body: A sessions court sentenced three men to life imprisonment for burning alive a former Nashik additional district collector, Yashwant Sonawane. The 46-year-old deceased was assaulted, sprayed with kerosene and burnt alive for objecting to oil adulteration in Manmad in 2011. The three were employees of the main accused, who had rented a 'dhaba' where the oil adulteration was taking place.

134.title: That smile? Priceless: Sunil Chhetri on Virat Kohli's celebration after scoring hundred
134.article_body: After Virat Kohli slammed his first international hundred in nearly three years, Indian men's football team captain Sunil Chhetri tweeted, "You can delay class all you want to...don't even think of denying it." He added, "That ton? Worth its weight in gold. That smile? Priceless. Shine on...champ." Kohli was seen smiling and kissing his engagement ring while celebrating his ton.

135.title: Mumbai Dabbawalas mourn Queen's demise, say 'had close relation with Royals'
135.article_body: The Mumbai Dabbawala Association has condoled the death of Queen Elizabeth II. "Mumbai Dabbawala Association has had a very close relationship with British Royal Family ever since Prince Charles visited India. We're very sad to hear about the death of Queen Elizabeth II and all Dabbawalas pray that her soul rests in peace," Subhash Talekar, Association Chairman, said.

136.title: Pelé shares old pics with Queen Elizabeth II, says 'I have been a great admirer'
136.article_body: Brazilian football legend Pelé penned a note after the demise of Queen Elizabeth II. Sharing pictures, he wrote, "I've been a great admirer of Queen Elizabeth II since the first time I saw her in person, in 1968, when she came to Brazil." He added, "A few years later...she generously awarded me...Order of the British Empire, the country's highest honor."

137.title: Karthik bowls for 1st time in his international career, gives away 18 runs in 6 balls
137.article_body: Team India wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik on Thursday bowled for the first time ever in his international career. The 37-year-old came to bowl the 20th over of Afghanistan's innings in their Asia Cup 2022 Super 4 stage match. He gave away 18 runs in the over, including two sixes. Karthik bowled off-spin deliveries.

138.title: India bans exports of broken rice, imposes 20% tax on non-basmati
138.article_body: India, the world's biggest rice exporter, has prohibited exports of broken rice and imposed a 20% levy on shipments of unmilled, semi-milled, wholly-milled and husked brown varieties from Friday, the government said. Some exports will, however, be allowed till September 15 with some conditions. The move will reportedly increase supplies and tame soaring local prices after below-average monsoons.

139.title: Ons Jabeur becomes 1st North African, Arab and Tunisian woman to reach US Open final
139.article_body: World number five Ons Jabeur of Tunisia defeated Caroline Garcia of France 6-1, 6-3 in the women's singles semi-finals to reach the US Open final for the first time. With this, she became the first North African, Arab and Tunisian woman to reach the US Open final. It's Jabeur's second straight Grand Slam final after finishing runner-up at Wimbledon 2022.

140.title: Rainbows appear over Buckingham Palace, Windsor Castle after Queen's death; pics viral
140.article_body: Rainbows appeared in UK after the demise of Queen Elizabeth II aged 96. A rainbow was spotted next to Windsor Castle, the Queen's residence in the English county of Berkshire. A double rainbow was seen over the Buckingham Palace. Reacting to the viral pictures, a social media user wrote, "Couldn't be more appropriate. May she rest in peace."

141.title: Staff bypassed us to cater her: Ishaan on Katrina's entry on 'Phone Bhoot' set
141.article_body: While talking about actress Katrina Kaif's entry on the set of 'Phone Bhoot', actor Ishaan Khatter said that "everything fell silent". "People were talking in hushed tones, and the aura just changed. There were staff literally bypassing us to go cater to her," he said, adding that everything was in chaos before Kaif entered the set.

142.title: Bengaluru reports 262 new COVID-19 cases, no deaths
142.article_body: Bengaluru reported 262 new COVID-19 infections in a day, taking the cumulative total to 18,67,742 cases, Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) Chief Commissioner said on Thursday. No new deaths were reported, so the overall toll remained at 16,983. The number of active cases was 2,746, while the infection positivity rate stood at 3.01%.

143.title: No Ganpati Visarjan at Mumbai's Sanjay Gandhi National Park: Bombay HC
143.article_body: The Bombay High Court on Thursday directed the Maharashtra government to ensure that there is no immersion of Ganesh idols inside Sanjay Gandhi National Park (SGNP) in Mumbai. "If any attempt is made in breach of law then...forest authorities are free to take appropriate steps,'' the bench said. The order came following a PIL filed by city-based NGO 'Mumbai March'.

144.title: India reports 6,093 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 49,636
144.article_body: India has reported 6,093 COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 6,395 COVID-19 cases. Active cases in India stand at 49,636, while the death toll has risen to 5,28,121, according to the latest data.

145.title: Twitter agreed to pay $7 million to whistleblower in June: Report
145.article_body: Twitter agreed in June to pay about $7 million to the whistleblower whose allegations will be part of Elon Musk's case against the company, the Wall Street Journal reported. The whistleblower, Peiter "Mudge" Zatko, accused the social media firm of falsely claiming it had a solid security plan and making misleading statements about its defences against hackers and spam accounts.

146.title: Pet dog bites off chunk of boy's face in Ghaziabad; pic shows him after 150 stitches
146.article_body: A pet pitbull bit off a chunk of 11-year-old boy's face in Ghaziabad recently, following which the boy was hospitalised and received around 150 stitches. The boy's father said that the dog attacked the boy in a park after the dog's leash slipped from its owner's hand. The dog's owner has been fined ₹5,000 for not registering the dog.

147.title: Show us proof: Russia on US' claim Moscow seeking arms from N Korea
147.article_body: The US and the UK should provide proof to support their allegations that Moscow was seeking drones from Iran and rockets and artillery shells from North Korea to use in Ukraine, Russia's UN Ambassador said, addressing the UN Security Council. "Either provide us with evidence or acknowledge that you are disseminating unreliable information," Ambassador Vassily Nebenzia said on Thursday.

148.title: ED raids premises of Punjab AAP MLA Jaswant Singh Majra: Reports
148.article_body: Enforcement Directorate (ED) reportedly raided the premises of Aam Aadmi Party's Punjab MLA Jaswant Singh Gajjan Majra. ED reportedly carried out searches at Tara Haveli in Sangrur, Tara Convent School, Tara Golden Homes and Tara Feed Industry in Malerkotla, all linked to Majra. This comes four months after CBI raided his three Sangrur-located properties in an alleged bank fraud case.

149.title: 22-yr-old student dies by suicide after failing NEET-UG in Gr Noida
149.article_body: A 22-year-old female student allegedly died by suicide at her society in Greater Noida's Sector-151 on Thursday after she failed her NEET-UG exam. The deceased was stressed after failing the exam and her body has been sent for post-mortem, according to the police. This comes after a 19-year-old girl allegedly died by suicide in Chennai after failing the NEET-UG exam.

150.title: Biden signs condolence book for Queen Elizabeth II at UK embassy
150.article_body: US President Joe Biden and First Lady Jill Biden visited the British Embassy in Washington DC to sign a condolence book for Queen Elizabeth II. "We mourn for all of you. She was a great lady. I'm so delighted I got to meet her," Biden told embassy staff after signing the book. The Queen, Britain's longest-serving monarch, died on Thursday.

151.title: Govt offices, schools in Hyd to be closed today for Ganpati Visarjan
151.article_body: Telangana announced a holiday for government offices, schools and colleges in and around the twin cities of Hyderabad and Secunderabad, Ranga Reddy and Medchal-Malkajgiri districts on account of Ganesh idols immersion processions on Friday. The government added that November 12, which is the second Saturday, will be a working day in lieu of the holiday on Friday.

152.title: Pune civic body arranges 204 mobile tanks for immersion of idols
152.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation has arranged 204 mobile tanks and 303 artificial ponds in the city for the immersion of Ganesh idols on Friday. The civic body is also collecting idols at 216 places and along with an NGO, it is also collecting 'nirmalya', the flowers offered to Lord Ganesh. The flowers will be used to prepare fertilisers.

153.title: First he was Rumi with long hair: Ayan on Ranbir's Brahmastra character Shiva
153.article_body: Filmmaker Ayan Mukerji took to Instagram to share a picture of actor Ranbir Kapoor from an early look test for 'Brahmastra'. He revealed that Kapoor's character who is now named Shiva was earlier called Rumi. "First, he was Rumi. Rumi with long hair...we gave Ranbir a haircut, and Rumi became...Shiva," he wrote in the caption.

154.title: 4-yr-old swept away in drain following heavy rain in Thane, search underway
154.article_body: A four-year-old boy was swept away in a drain on a waterlogged street in Thane's Kalwa area following heavy rainfall on Thursday. According to Regional Disaster Management Cell (RDMC) chief Avinash Sawant, water in the locality was around four feet deep. "We...got...information about a four-year-old who was feared drowned and a search operation has been initiated," Sawant added.

155.title: Amritsar-born Devika Bulchandani appointed CEO of global advertising agency Ogilvy
155.article_body: Amritsar-born Devika Bulchandani has been appointed as the Global Chief Executive Officer of advertising agency Ogilvy, which has presence in 93 countries. Devika, who was serving as Global President and CEO of Ogilvy North America, succeeds Andy Main who is stepping down as Global CEO and will serve as a Senior Advisor until the end of the year.

156.title: Anushka shares pics of Kohli after he hits ton, says 'Forever with you through everything'
156.article_body: Anushka Sharma took to Instagram to share pictures of Virat Kohli celebrating after slamming his first international hundred in nearly three years. "Forever with you through any and everything," she wrote. Kohli dedicated his hundred to Anushka and their daughter Vamika. Kohli scored 122*(61) against Afghanistan on Thursday, his first-ever T20I hundred.

157.title: ABD shares pic with Kohli on scooter, says 'With his 100 I thought I’d share this memory'
157.article_body: Ex-South Africa captain AB de Villiers on Thursday took to social media to share an old picture of himself with Virat Kohli on a scooter. He captioned the picture, "With his 100 today...I thought I'd share this memory...Top knock...my friend. Many more to come." "Thanks biscuit. Love you," Kohli commented on his post. Meanwhile, Anushka Sharma commented, "Oh my god."

158.title: What is Operation Unicorn, activated in UK after Queen's death?
158.article_body: Funeral plans for UK Queen Elizabeth II codenamed 'London Bridge' were leaked in the media last year, however, due to her demise in Scotland, it was codenamed to 'Operation Unicorn', according to reports. The day of Queen's death will be referred to as D-Day. As a part of the operation, BBC presenters wore black and channels switched to rolling news.

159.title: 'Chor Raja' wanted in over 100 cases arrested by Pune Police
159.article_body: Pune Police arrested a criminal, identified as Rajesh Ram Papul aka 'Chor Raja', who was wanted in over 100 cases. Following his arrest from his house, the 37-year-old criminal has been remanded to police custody till September 12. It was only after installing a GPS machine in his fiancée's footwear that police were able to arrest him, an officer said.

160.title: Govt to form authority to manage traffic in Bengaluru: CM Bommai
160.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Thursday said that an authority will be formed to manage traffic in Bengaluru and that a bill to this effect will be introduced in the upcoming Assembly session. He added that several tasks are being undertaken by NHAI, BBMP, PWD and other departments and a comprehensive master plan will resolve most of the problems.

161.title: It was quite shocking for me that my 60s became failures: Virat Kohli on criticism
161.article_body: Referring to criticism he faced during his 1,019-day international century drought, Virat Kohli said, "What actually surprised me was my 60s became failures which was quite shocking for me." He added, "I was...batting pretty well and contributing but it didn't seem to be good enough. Kohli slammed a hundred after 1,019 days on Thursday, registering 122*(61) against Afghanistan.

162.title: Video of Kohli telling Bhuvneshwar 'Abhi hai cricket baaki' after smashing ton goes viral
162.article_body: A video of Team India batter Virat Kohli telling his teammate Bhuvneshwar Kumar 'Abhi hai cricket baaki (There's still cricket left)' after smashing a hundred after nearly three years has gone viral. Kohli made the remark when he was being greeted by his teammates following India's innings against Afghanistan in their Asia Cup 2022 Super 4 stage match on Thursday.

163.title: What will be the new Royal titles of Queen's son Charles, Prince William and Kate?
163.article_body: After the death of Queen Elizabeth II, her son Charles will be crowned King Charles III. Charles' son Prince William, and William's wife are now titled Duke and Duchess of Cornwall and Cambridge. William will not automatically become Prince of Wales - that will have to be conferred on him by his father. Charles' wife, Camilla, becomes the Queen Consort.

164.title: Mumbai witnesses heavy rain, IMD predicts thunderstorms; yellow alert issued
164.article_body: Mumbai received heavy rainfall on Thursday. The India Meteorological Department has predicted thunderstorms with lightning, light to moderate rainfall and gusty winds in the city. A yellow alert was also issued for Mumbai. The rainfall started at around 4:30 pm and intensified between 5 to 6 pm. Reports said that rail and road traffic was affected due to rains.

165.title: Noida Power Company Limited employee electrocuted during repair work
165.article_body: A man working with the Noida Power Company Limited was electrocuted to death while repairing power lines in Sector 10. "Another lineman told us that the power on the line he was fixing was shut...line he was working on became live," the deceased's nephew said. The line that the man was working on was switched on suddenly, the nephew added.

166.title: Congress leader Siddaramaiah visits flooded areas in B'luru on boat
166.article_body: Senior Congress leader Siddaramaiah on Thursday took a boat ride to the flood-affected areas in Bengaluru and interacted with the locals. He met the residents of Epsilon residential complex in Yemalur, which is home to some of the biggest entrepreneurs in Bengaluru. Further, he visited the residence of the 23-year-old woman who was recently electrocuted to death in Bengaluru.

167.title: There was nobody like her: Donald Trump on Queen Elizabeth II's demise
167.article_body: Condoling Queen Elizabeth II's demise, former US President Donald Trump said, "What a grand and beautiful lady she was—there was nobody like her!" He further said, "Melania and I will always cherish our time together with the Queen, and never forget Her Majesty’s generous friendship, great wisdom, and wonderful sense of humor."

168.title: Joe Biden releases statement on Queen Elizabeth II's demise, says 'She defined an era'
168.article_body: US President Joe Biden and First Lady Jill Biden released a statement following the demise of Queen Elizabeth II. "[She] was more than a monarch. She defined an era," the statement read. "She stood in solidarity with...US during our darkest days after 9/11...when she poignantly reminded us that 'Grief is the price we pay for love'," the statement added.

169.title: Need more opportunities for Indian startups' ideas to go global: Goyal
169.article_body: Speaking in the US, Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal said that Indian startups need more opportunities so that their ideas can reach out to the global market and stated that "Silicon Valley is the best place for an idea to go global". He added that the government is playing the role of facilitator between Indian startups and US-based investors.

170.title: Neeraj Chopra creates history, becomes first-ever Indian to win Diamond Trophy
170.article_body: Olympic gold medal-winning Indian javelin thrower Neeraj Chopra has created history by becoming the first-ever Indian to win Diamond Trophy. The 24-year-old won the Diamond League final in Zurich with a best throw of 88.44 metres. Apart from the Diamond Trophy, Neeraj also won a prize money of $30,000.

171.title: Target drops mandatory CEO retirement age, Cornell to stay for 3 more yrs
171.article_body: US-based merchandise retailer Target has dropped the mandatory retirement age for its CEO. This would allow CEO Brian Cornell to serve the position for three more years. Under Cornell's leadership, who took the position in 2014, the chain has expanded its customer base and accelerated its curbside pickups, online and same-day services.

172.title: Starbucks to rehire 7 fired Memphis workers after losing appeal
172.article_body: Starbucks will rehire seven employees who were fired after leading an effort to unionise Memphis store. Starbucks, which opposes unionisation, said employees violated company policy by reopening the store post-closing time and inviting non-employees. The National Labour Relations Board said Starbucks was interfering with workers' right to organise and asked a federal court in Memphis to intervene.

173.title: Friday's play in 3rd England-SA Test to not take place due to Queen Elizabeth II's demise
173.article_body: The second day's play in the third England-South Africa Test at Kennington Oval in London will not take place on Friday as scheduled due to the demise of Queen Elizabeth II, the England and Wales Cricket Board (ECB) announced. Further, all scheduled matches in the Rachael Heyhoe Flint Trophy, will also not take place on Friday.

174.title: Nothing more noble than to devote life to service of others: Tim Cook on Queen's demise
