174.article_body: Apple CEO Tim Cook took to Twitter to condole the demise of Queen Elizabeth II. He wrote, "There's nothing more noble than to devote your life to the service of others. We stand with the people of the UK and Commonwealth in honoring the life and dedication to duty of her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II."

175.title: King Charles issues statement after Queen's death, says 'Her loss will be deeply felt'
175.article_body: Following Queen Elizabeth II's demise, her son King Charles said, "The death of my beloved Mother, Her Majesty The Queen, is a moment of the greatest sadness for me and all members of my family." "I know her loss will be deeply felt throughout the country, the Realms and the Commonwealth, and by countless people around the world," he added.

176.title: Not my career or personal goal: Idris Elba on playing James Bond
176.article_body: Idris Elba said playing James Bond is not a goal for his career and he doesn't think it will "satisfy some of my personal goals". However, he said if he's cast as the spy, it'll "definitely satisfy the will of a nation". Idris added, "I'm not that guy, but in everyone's world I might be. And that - job done."

177.title: Yami Gautam's 'Lost' to open Chicago South Asian Film Festival
177.article_body: Actress Yami Gautam's upcoming film 'Lost' will serve as the opening film at the Chicago South Asian Film Festival (CSAFF). Reacting to the news, Yami said she "can't be happier and more proud". Yami said working on the Aniruddha Roy Chowdhury directorial was a "special experience" as it allowed her to explore "many layers of emotions as an actor".

178.title: Prince Charles becomes UK King after death of Queen Elizabeth II
178.article_body: Prince Charles has become the King of UK after the death of his mother, Queen Elizabeth II. The 73-year-old had been next in line to the throne for seven decades. Meanwhile, his wife Camilla has become the Queen Consort. Queen Elizabeth II passed away aged 96 at Balmoral on Thursday.

179.title: Ranbir visits Lalbaugcha Raja with Ayan ahead of 'Brahmastra' release
179.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor and Ayan Mukerji visited Lalbaugcha Raja on Thursday to seek blessings of Lord Ganesh for their film 'Brahmastra'. On his Instagram account, Ayan shared that he is "so excited for everyone to experience" the film in theatres. Slated for September 9 release, 'Brahmastra' features Alia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor sharing the screen space for the first time.

180.title: PM Modi shares old pics with Queen Elizabeth II, says 'Pained by her demise'
180.article_body: Condoling the demise of Queen Elizabeth II, PM Narendra Modi tweeted, "I had memorable meetings with Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II during my UK visits in 2015 and 2018. I'll never forget her warmth and kindness." "Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II will be remembered as a stalwart...She provided inspiring leadership to her nation and people...Pained by her demise," he added.

181.title: Kapil is & will remain at the top of his game: Archana Puran Singh
181.article_body: Archana Puran Singh on Thursday shared a video, which also featured Kapil Sharma. Along with the post, Archana wrote about Kapil and said he "is and always will remain at the top of his game" because of his ability to bring humour to everything. Commenting on his latest look, Archana revealed Kapil's wife Ginni Chatrath was behind his "sartorial transformation".

182.title: What jungle raj? There is janta raj in Bihar: CM Nitish Kumar
182.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar on Thursday dismissed BJP's claim that 'jungle raj' (lawlessness) has returned to the state after the Mahagathbandhan government came to power. "What jungle raj? Maintaining law and order has been [our] priority...There's janta raj," he added. He stated that BJP leaders Sushil Modi and Sanjay Jaiswal may get "plum posts" in the party for criticising him.

183.title: Rajasthan Zila Parishad member arrested for taking bribe
183.article_body: A Rajasthan Zila Parishad member was arrested by the Anti-Corruption Bureau in Bikaner for taking a bribe of ₹10 lakh. The Bikaner Zila Parishad member had asked for a bribe of ₹21 lakh from a complainant to take action in a land-related matter. After the complaint was verified, a trap was laid and the accused was arrested.

184.title: Olympian Dutee Chand to join 'Jhalak Dikhhla Jaa 10' as wild card
184.article_body: Olympian Dutee Chand will be entering 'Jhalak Dikhhla Jaa 10' as a wild card. Talking about the show, Dutee said she is excited about the challenge and will "perform to the best of my capabilities". She added, "I am used to performing in front of live viewers, but this is going to be a new experience altogether."

185.title: NGT imposes ₹12,000 cr fine on Maha for environmental norms violation
185.article_body: The National Green Tribunal (NGT) on Thursday imposed a fine of ₹12,000 crore on the state of Maharashtra for allegedly not managing solid and liquid waste, causing harm to the environment. Without fixing quantified liability necessary for restoration, mere passing of orders has not shown any tangible results, the NGT said. The penalty has to be paid within two months.

186.title: Perfume trader Piyush Jain released on bail after 8 months
186.article_body: Uttar Pradesh perfume trader Piyush Jain was released on bail after 8 months in jail, officials said. Last year, his premises were raided by central agencies, and around ₹200 crore in cash and 23 kg of gold were seized. His bail plea was accepted by the Allahabad High Court, and his family members filed two sureties each of ₹10 lakh.

187.title: Corruption by a civil servant is offence against society: SC
187.article_body: Corruption by a civil servant is an offence against society and state, the Supreme Court said on Thursday. The court made the observation while hearing a Madras High Court order which dismissed a criminal complaint in a cash­-for-­job scam, citing settlement between parties. The apex court held the High Court was "completely in error in quashing the criminal complaint".

188.title: Queen Elizabeth II, Britain's longest-serving monarch, passes away aged 96
188.article_body: Queen Elizabeth II, Britain's longest-serving monarch, has passed away aged 96. On Thursday, Buckingham Palace had released a statement saying she was under medical supervision as her doctors were concerned for her health. The monarch had been facing health problems since October last year that left her with difficulties walking and standing.

189.title: Vicky's principles and values were so overwhelming: Katrina
189.article_body: Actress Katrina Kaif said husband Vicky Kaushal's "principles and values" were "overwhelming" for her. Explaining Vicky's bond with his family, Katrina said she knew he'd give the same kind of respect and importance to his wife and kids. She said with time, she understood what's important in a relationship and "what's going to take you through in the long run".

190.title: My sister-in-law was my inspiration: Tamannaah on 'Babli Bouncer'
190.article_body: Actress Tamannaah Bhatia revealed on 'The Kapil Sharma Show' that her sister-in-law was her inspiration to play her character in 'Babli Bouncer'. "Most people don't know that my bhabhi is Haryanvi. When I heard the narration of this film, I thought to myself that I had a real-life inspiration around me because she has a happy-go-lucky personality," she said.

191.title: UK's Leicester Police call for calm after India-Pak cricket match
191.article_body: Leicester Police in east England appealed for calm on Thursday, following days of unrest reportedly between Hindu and Muslim groups. The tensions spiked after an international cricket match between India and Pakistan, held last month. "Enjoy the cricket...but don't use that as an excuse...for stirring up things that frankly don't belong in our city of Leicester," Mayor Peter Soulsby said.

192.title: ITBP jawans escape with minor injuries after bus mishap in U'khand
192.article_body: Ten Indo-Tibetan Border Police (ITBP) jawans on Thursday narrowly escaped death after the bus they were travelling in fell into a gorge in Champawat district, Uttarakhand. The bus had a fall of about 15 metres and fortunately the jawans escaped with mild injuries, Champawat SP Devendra Pincha said. The bus was going from Banbasa to Pithoragarh.

193.title: I was a bit shocked: Kohli on hitting a century in a T20I to end his 1,019-day drought
193.article_body: Talking about ending his 1,019-day international hundred drought by slamming his first-ever T20I hundred, Virat Kohli said, "I was actually a bit shocked." He added, "This was the format I least expected a century to come anytime soon." "This hundred is especially dedicated to Anushka Sharma (wife) and our little daughter Vamika," Kohli further said.

194.title: Telangana Governor alleges 'humiliation' by KCR govt
194.article_body: The Governor of Telangana Tamilisai Soundararajan alleged that K Chandrashekar Rao-led TRS state government has humiliated and discriminated against the Governor's office. Addressing a gathering at the Raj Bhavan, she said that she was disheartened at not being allowed to hoist the Tricolour on Independence Day. "History will remember how a woman Governor was discriminated (against)," she added.

195.title: 62-yr-old man molests 9-yr-old girl in a lift in Guj, caught on camera
195.article_body: A 62-year-old man was arrested for allegedly molesting a nine-year-old girl in Gujarat's Ahmedabad. According to police officials, the accused molested the girl inside a lift of a residential society. The incident came to light after it was caught on a CCTV camera inside the lift. The girl narrated the incident to her family, following which a complaint was registered.

196.title: Jaffer shares 'Elo Ji Sanam Hum Aa Gaye' song, says 'Kohli to the cricket world today'
196.article_body: After Virat Kohli smashed a hundred in international cricket after 1,019 days, Wasim Jaffer took to Twitter to share a video of the song 'Elo Ji Sanam Hum Aa Gaye' from 'Andaz Apna Apna'. He wrote, "Virat Kohli to the cricket world today." Kohli slammed 122* off 61 deliveries against Afghanistan, his first-ever hundred in T20I cricket.

197.title: Germany reviews measures to curb business with China: Report
197.article_body: The German economy ministry is considering a raft of measures to make business with China less attractive as it seeks to reduce its dependency on the country, Reuters reported. The measures could include reducing or even scrapping investment and export guarantees for China. Loans from state lender KfW could reportedly be redirected to projects in other Asian countries.

198.title: India defeat Afghanistan in their last Asia Cup 2022 match, break multiple records
198.article_body: India defeated Afghanistan by 101 runs in their last Asia Cup 2022 match on Thursday. India recorded the highest-ever total (212/2) in men's T20 Asia Cup history. The match also witnessed Virat Kohli record the highest-ever individual score (122*) by an Indian in T20I cricket. Further, Bhuvneshwar Kumar, with 84 wickets, became the highest wicket-taker for India in T20I cricket.

199.title: UK PM Liz Truss unveils plan to tackle cost-of-living crisis
199.article_body: British PM Liz Truss on Thursday announced a two-year plan to address the country's cost-of-living crisis, placing a maximum annual cap of GBP 2,500 on energy bills for households from October 1. Truss said the measure would save households around £1,000 annually. "We are facing a global energy crisis and there are no 'cost-free' options," Truss said.

200.title: Akhilesh Yadav a sinking ship, SP a party of goons: UP Dy CM
200.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Deputy CM Brajesh Pathak on Thursday called Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav a "sinking ship" and called his party a "party of goons", which has been deleted from the state. "We have defeated the Samajwadi Party in 2017, 2019 and 2022," Pathak said. "Mafia and goons used to encroach over shops and houses in their government," Pathak added.

201.title: Union Cabinet approves revision of Railways’ land policy
201.article_body: The Union Cabinet has okayed the Railways Ministry's proposal to update the railways' land policy to help implement the PM Gati Shakti framework. As part of the revision, ​​​​​​​300 cargo terminals will be developed over the next five years. The framework is expected to help attract more cargo to railways and increase its modal share in freight transportation.

202.title: Palaniswami visits AIADMK headquarters in Chennai amid rousing welcome
202.article_body: AIADMK Interim General Secretary Edappadi K Palaniswami (EPS) on Thursday visited the party headquarters in Chennai for the first time after being elected to the post. He was welcomed by a huge gathering of his supporters. He said elections for the post of the party's General Secretary will be conducted soon.

203.title: Special gallery to be dedicated to workers who built new Parliament building: PM
203.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Thursday praised workers engaged in constructing the new Parliament building and announced they will have a special gallery dedicated to them. He said the workers involved in development of Kartavya Path not only built it but also showed others a way of 'kartavya (duty)'. The Rajpath and Central Vista lawns area has been renamed 'Kartavya Path'.

204.title: Smuggler shot dead by BSF troops on Indo-Bangladesh border
204.article_body: The Border Security Force (BSF) shot dead an alleged smuggler in West Bengal's North Dinajpur district during an encounter on the Indo-Bangladesh border, officials said on Thursday. A senior BSF officer informed that the incident took place on Wednesday at 9.05 pm. A BSF personnel allegedly fired in self-defence resulting in the death of a Bangladeshi miscreant, who was armed.

205.title: Nearly 1,000 children rescued from trafficking since 2019: Jharkhand official
205.article_body: Nearly 1,000 children and youths from Jharkhand have been rescued from being trafficked since 2019, an official said. Of them, 126 children were below 10 years of age and 359 were in the age group of 11 to 14. The figures came to light during a workshop organised by Jharkhand State Child Protection Society in Hehal, Jharkhand on Thursday.

206.title: Renaming Rajpath as Kartavya Path is welcome step: Himachal Cong MLA
206.article_body: Congress MLA Vikramaditya Singh, the son of former Himachal Pradesh CM late Virbhadra Singh, on Thursday said the decision of Narendra Modi-led BJP government to rename Rajpath to 'Kartavya Path' in Delhi is a welcome step. "British rule ended. The name of Britishers on every building should be changed," Vikramaditya Singh said in a Facebook post.

207.title: Dunzo Bengaluru operations hit after delivery partners protest
207.article_body: Dunzo delivery workers in Bengaluru are protesting changes in payment structures and have stayed away from work, affecting operations in the city. The delivery workers went on strike on September 7 and 8 at Dunzo's XpressMart store in Frazer Town, leading to services being suspended. A message on the app read, "Dunzo Daily will be back in a while."

208.title: 17 injured as bus overturns in MP, passengers say driver was speeding
208.article_body: Around 17 passengers sustained injuries after a bus overturned in Jamunia Ghat in Madhya Pradesh's Raisen district on Thursday. A police official informed that the injured passengers have been hospitalised. "Passengers have said the driver was speeding and lost control of the vehicle," the official said, adding that the driver managed to run away from the scene following the incident.

209.title: Centre alone can't be responsible for managing inflation: Sitharaman
209.article_body: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has said the inflation cannot be handled only by the Centre and states, too, must play their part. RBI forms a critical part of inflation management, but fiscal policy has to work together with monetary policy in handling the inflationary surge, she said. Inflation is higher in states that haven't reduced fuel prices, she added.

210.title: Mentally unstable man trampled to death by elephants in Chhattisgarh
210.article_body: A 50-year-old mentally unstable man, identified as Bindeshwar Gond, was trampled to death by two elephants under Rajpur forest range in Chhattisgarh's Balrampur district  on Thursday, an official said. "The family of the deceased was given immediate aid of ₹25,000, while remaining compensation of ₹5.75 lakh will be given after completion of formalities," the official added.

211.title: US approves $675m in additional military aid to Ukraine
211.article_body: US President Joe Biden has sanctioned additional defence aid to Ukraine worth about $675 million, US Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin said on Thursday. He said the package includes Humvees, howitzers, artillery munitions, armoured ambulances and anti-tank systems. The US has sent aid worth several billions of dollars to Kyiv since Russia's invasion of Ukraine began in February this year.

212.title: US planning $2.8 bn military aid for nations threatened by Russia
212.article_body: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken visited Kyiv on Thursday and said Washington is planning to grant fresh military support worth over $2.8 billion to Ukraine and other European nations threatened by Russia. Blinken met President Volodymyr Zelenskyy, among other Ukrainian leaders. Blinken said the US will support Ukraine "for as long as it takes" in its war against Russia.

213.title: Anti-India slogans raised at Jammu college after Pak-Afg match
213.article_body: Anti-India slogans were allegedly raised at a college in Jammu after Pakistan beat Afghanistan in an Asia Cup 2022 match held on Wednesday. Several students staged a protest at MAM College premises earlier today against the alleged slogans. "[We've] received complaints of anti-national slogans raised in the hostel after the match...We will take strict action," the college's principal said.

214.title: Goa's Curlies beach shack set to be demolished
214.article_body: The Curlies shack in Goa will be demolished soon for allegedly flouting the coastal zone regulations. The National Green Tribunal, or NGT, upheld Goa Coastal Zone Management Authority's earlier order to demolish the shack. The green court's order comes days after BJP leader Sonali Phogat was allegedly drugged at a party in Curlies hours before her death.

215.title: ABD reveals he had a conversation with Kohli yesterday, says 'Knew something was brewing'
215.article_body: After Virat Kohli smashed his first-ever T20I hundred on Thursday, his former RCB teammate AB de Villiers revealed that he had a conversation with Kohli on Wednesday. De Villiers wrote, "When I spoke to him yesterday I knew something was brewing...Well played my friend." De Villiers also wrote, "Virat Kohli dancing again! What a lovely sight."

216.title: Bhuvneshwar Kumar breaks record for taking most wickets for India in T20I cricket
216.article_body: Team India fast bowler Bhuvneshwar Kumar on Thursday broke the record for taking most wickets for India in T20I cricket. The 32-year-old registered his career-best figures of 4-1-4-5 against Afghanistan in Asia Cup to take his tally of wickets in T20I cricket to 84. He overtook Yuzvendra Chahal, who has taken 83 wickets in T20I cricket.

217.title: Prisoner flees from hospital during treatment in Punjab's Kapurthala
217.article_body: An inmate of Kapurthala jail in Punjab ran away from the local civil hospital where he was undergoing treatment on Thursday. The inmate, a resident of a village near Phillaur, was arrested in a theft case on September 5 and later sent to judicial remand. A police official said that several teams have been formed to find him.

218.title: Kohli kisses engagement ring to celebrate his 1st hundred after 1,019 days, pics go viral
218.article_body: Former Team India captain Virat Kohli celebrated his first hundred after 1,019 days by kissing his engagement ring which he wears around his neck in a chain. Pictures and videos of his celebration have gone viral on social media. Kohli, during an interview after the innings, dedicated the hundred to his wife Anushka Sharma and their daughter Vamika.

219.title: Suryakumar Yadav breaks fridge in Afghanistan dugout with a 69-metre six, video viral
219.article_body: India batter Suryakumar Yadav smashed the first ball of his innings against Afghanistan in Asia Cup 2022 on Thursday for a 69-metre six, which went on to break a part of the fridge placed in Afghanistan's dugout. A video of the same went viral on social media. Suryakumar then got out on the very next delivery bowled by Fareed Ahmad.

220.title: Offering funeral prayers of slain militant not anti-national activity: HC
220.article_body: Offering of funeral prayers of a killed militant by the public cannot be construed to be anti-national activity of that magnitude so as to deprive them of their personal liberty, the Jammu and Kashmir and Ladakh High Court ruled. The court upheld the bail granted to few villagers and an Imam accused of offering funeral prayers of a killed militant.

221.title: Technology can never replace books: PM Narendra Modi
221.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi said that although technology is an important source of information and the internet can be used as and when required, but it cannot be an alternative to books. Speaking at the inauguration of a book fair in Ahmedabad, PM Modi said, "Books and text are basic elements of our education and worship."

222.title: Finance Ministry to begin preparing for 2023-24 Budget from Oct 10
222.article_body: The Finance Ministry will begin the exercise to prepare the annual Budget for the FY 2023-24 from October 10. The Budget will be focused on addressing critical issues of high inflation, creating demand, job creation and putting the economy on a sustained 8 per cent-plus growth path. Notably, it'll be the fifth Budget of the PM Narendra Modi-led central government.

223.title: Contestants are sensitive: Karan Johar on sugarcoating himself on 'Jhalak...'
223.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar, who is one of the judges on the dance reality show 'Jhalak Dikhhla Jaa', said he sugar-coats himself extra on the show to make his point at times. "I'm much more judgmental than I'm allowed to be," he said. "Especially when it comes to 'Jhalak...', everyone is a celebrity and thus quite sensitive and vulnerable," he added.

224.title: Mental health issues cost Indian firms $14 billion a year: Deloitte
224.article_body: A survey by Deloitte found that poor mental health amongst employees costs Indian companies $14 billion annually due to absenteeism and other reasons. About 47% of the 4,000 workers surveyed considered workplace-related stress as the biggest factor affecting their mental health, followed by financial challenges. IT sector reported the highest percentage of employees with mental health symptoms.

225.title: Virat Kohli breaks record for highest-ever score by an Indian in T20I cricket
225.article_body: Former Team India captain Virat Kohli on Thursday recorded the highest-ever score by an Indian in T20I cricket after scoring 122* off 61 deliveries against Afghanistan in Asia Cup 2022. He broke the previous record held by Rohit Sharma, who had slammed 118(43) against Sri Lanka on December 22, 2017. Kohli has now slammed 71 hundreds in international cricket.

226.title: HC misread Quran to hold hijab as non-essential practice: Petitioner in SC
226.article_body: Advocate Nizam Pasha, a counsel representing petitioners in the hijab ban case, told the SC that Karnataka HC misread the Quran's verses to hold that hijab's use wasn't an essential religious practice but a cultural one. "To say the verses have lost meaning with time is bordering on blasphemy," said Pasha. He also drew parallel between a hijab and turban.

227.title: Don't compare Sikh turbans, kirpans with hijab: SC on K'taka hijab row
227.article_body: The Supreme Court (SC) on Thursday told petitioners in the case challenging the hijab ban in Karnataka government educational institutions that comparisons with turbans worn by Sikhs are 'inappropriate'. "The SC has recognised turbans worn by Sikhs as one of...five essential components of Sikhism," Justice Hemant Gupta said. Carrying of the kirpan is recognised by the Constitution, he added.

228.title: ICC announces T20 World Cup 2022 warm-up fixtures
228.article_body: ICC today announced warm-up fixtures for the men's T20 World Cup 2022 that will begin in October in Australia. India will face hosts and reigning champions Australia in their first warm-up match on October 17 at The Gabba. India will face New Zealand two days later at the same venue. Pakistan will face England and Afghanistan in their warm-up fixtures.

229.title: Husband, wife & son try to kidnap 7-yr-old girl in UP; villagers save her
229.article_body: A seven-year-old girl was saved by villagers in UP's Belipar village after three members of a family, who worked as sanitation workers, tried to kidnap her. The three people, including a husband, wife and son, tried to lure the girl with a toffee while she was on her way to school. The kidnappers were caught after the girl started crying.

230.title: New era has begun in the form of Kartavya Path: PM Modi
230.article_body: PM Narendra Modi after inaugurating the revamped Central Vista Avenue said a new era has begun in the form of Kartavya Path. The Rajpath (formerly 'Kingsway') and Central Vista lawns area has been renamed Kartavya Path. "Symbol of colonialism, 'Kingsway', is history now and it has been erased forever," PM Modi added.

231.title: Meta, Twitter to testify in US panel on social media's impact on homeland security
231.article_body: Facebook-parent Meta, Twitter, YouTube and TikTok will testify on September 14 at the US Senate Committee on Homeland Security and Government Affairs on social media's impact on homeland security. The committee said it'll be an opportunity to understand the extent to which these firms' business models contribute to amplifying harmful content. Panel will also hear from former Facebook executives.

232.title: Security given when Yakub was buried, whose govt was it then?: Aaditya
232.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Aaditya Thackeray on Thursday refuted the BJP's claims that the former Maharashtra government under ex-CM Uddhav Thackeray was responsible for the alleged beautification of terrorist Yakub Memon's grave. "Why was Yakub Memon not dumped at sea like Osama Bin Laden? Whose government was it then? When he was buried, great security was provided," Thackeray told reporters.

233.title: Kohli smashes an international hundred after 1,019 days, records his 1st T20I century
233.article_body: Virat Kohli on Thursday smashed his first-ever T20I hundred, reaching the three-figure mark off 53 deliveries against Afghanistan in Asia Cup 2022. Kohli has hit an international hundred after 1,019 days. Kohli has now equalled former Australia captain Ricky Ponting's tally of 71 hundreds in international cricket.

234.title: Nawazuddin & Aaliya Siddiqui to team up for Teejan Bai's biopic
234.article_body: Producer Aaliya Siddiqui has roped in Nawazuddin Siddiqui to play one of the main characters in Chhattisgarh's veteran folk artiste Teejan Bai's biopic. Calling the film her "dream project", Aaliya said Nawaz has been a huge admirer of Teejan Bai's work since his theatre days. Aaliya said it will be her honour to bring Teejan Bai's story to the audience.

235.title: Some artificial sweeteners may be linked to heart diseases: Study
235.article_body: As per study, consumption of some artificial sweeteners may be associated with a greater risk of overall cardiovascular diseases. Researchers analysed artificial sweeteners in regular food products and found that aspartame present in it was linked to an increased risk of cerebrovascular events, while acesulfame potassium and sucralose were associated with a greater risk of coronary heart disease.

236.title: How did Tanishka become NEET UG 2022 topper despite 4 candidates scoring same marks?
236.article_body: Four candidates (Tanishka from Rajasthan, Vatsa Ashish Batra from Delhi, Hrishikesh Gangule and Rucha Pawashe from Karnataka) scored 715 out of 720 marks in NEET UG 2022. However, Tanishka was declared the topper due to the new tie-breaker policy which considers nine factors, including giving preference to candidate scoring higher marks/percentile in Biology, followed by Chemistry and others.

237.title: Firsts are always special: Kajol on OTT debut show 'The Good Wife'
237.article_body: Actress Kajol Devgan will be playing a lawyer in her debut web series 'The Good Wife'. Talking about it, Kajol said, "I have been playing multiple characters throughout my acting journey, but the firsts are always special." She added that OTT platforms allow creators and actors to reinvent and experiment, which is an opportunity she got with 'The Good Wife'.

238.title: JP Agarwal replaces Mukul Wasnik as MP Congress in-charge
238.article_body: Congress chief Sonia Gandhi appointed JP Agarwal as the Congress in-charge for Madhya Pradesh in place of Mukul Wasnik. Wasnik will reportedly continue as AICC general secretary but will oversee other organisational matters. "Congress president has accepted the request of Mukul Wasnik to relieve him from his responsibility as general secretary in-charge of Madhya Pradesh," a party statement said.

239.title: They didn't understand: Palash on being trolled for Atif Aslam post
239.article_body: Singer Palash Sen said people haven't understood his post on Atif Aslam. The singer, who was trolled for stating that Atif had "maximum impact on Bollywood", said he wanted to urge people to start asking bigger questions. "As Indians, we give so many opportunities to everybody, but I don't think we get the same reciprocation from other countries," he said.

240.title: Dynamic & huge: Madhavan on trailer of Vikram Vedha's Hindi remake
240.article_body: Actor R Madhavan has reacted to the trailer of the Hindi remake of 'Vikram Vedha', which stars Hrithik Roshan and Saif Ali Khan in the lead roles. Madhavan, who played Vikram in the film's original version, called the trailer "dynamic and huge". He said he "can't wait to see" the Pushkar-Gayatri directorial in theatres on September 30.

241.title: 30 students in Andhra hospitalised after complaining of suffocation
241.article_body: At least 30 students of a school in Andhra Pradesh's Kakinada district fell ill and were hospitalised on Wednesday after they complained of suffocation, according to reports. A few of the affected students reportedly also fell unconscious but all of them are now in stable condition. The students had reportedly complained of a foul smell in the classroom.

242.title: HDFC Bank raises ₹3,000 crore from bonds to fund business growth
242.article_body: Private sector lender HDFC Bank on Thursday said that it has raised ₹3,000 crore from bonds to fund business growth. The bank issued and allotted bonds to investors on a private placement basis on Thursday. These unsecured, subordinated, fully paid-up and non-convertible, Basel III compliant perpetual debt would carry a coupon rate of 7.84 per cent, it added.

243.title: Man hacked to death by Nihang Sikhs near Golden Temple for chewing tobacco
243.article_body: A factory worker was hacked to death by three men, including two Nihang Sikhs, over chewing tobacco on a street in Golden Temple's vicinity on Wednesday night. CCTV footage shows the three engaging in a fight with the man before he's hacked to death. One accused was arrested, and raids are being carried out to apprehend the remaining suspects.

244.title: India's fuel demand rises 16.3% in August to 17.81 million tonnes
244.article_body: India's fuel demand rose 16.3% in August as compared to the same period a year ago to 17.81 million tonnes, government data showed. Petrol sales were 11.6% higher from a year earlier at three million tonnes. Liquefied petroleum gas (LPG) sales increased 3% to 2.39 million tonnes, while naphtha sales surged 23.5% to 1.16 million tonnes.

245.title: Reliance-backed Netradyne receives $65 mn from Silicon Valley Bank
245.article_body: Reliance-backed software-as-a-service (SaaS) company Netradyne has received $65 million in debt financing from US-based Silicon Valley Bank (SVB). The Artificial Intelligence (AI) software provider was founded in 2015 by Avneesh Agrawal and David Julian. So far, Netradyne has raised $197.5 million from investors such as Reliance, Softbank, Point72, Microsoft Corp and Hyundai.

246.title: Scientists discover new solar system that could be home to alien life
246.article_body: A new planetary system with two distant planets orbiting around a small, cool star named LP 890-9 has been discovered. The planets, called LP 890-9b and LP 890-9c, take 2.7 and 8.5 days to complete one revolution around the star, respectively. The latter is also within the star's "habitable zone", making it neither too hot nor cold for alien life.

247.title: MPPSC aspirant turns into fruit chaat seller due to delayed results
247.article_body: A 28-year-old civil services aspirant has opened a fruit chaat stall with his friends in Indore due to the delayed results of Madhya Pradesh Public Service Commission (MPPSC) examinations, a report said. Tejprakash Kushwaha, who is preparing to take the 2021 Mains exams, said, "My family's financial condition isn't stable." Meanwhile, another MPPSC aspirant has started selling samosas in Indore.

248.title: Synchronised response to lower inflation is the best approach: RBI ED
248.article_body: Reserve Bank of India Executive Director (ED) Sitikantha Pattanaik on Thursday said a synchronised response to lowering inflation is the best approach. Central banks can and must deliver price stability but there's a debate on whether they alone could deliver it, Pattanaik said. India had not seen "massive" fiscal interventions to ease prices as seen recently, he added.

249.title: PM interacts with Central Vista workers, invites them to R-Day parade
249.article_body: PM Narendra Modi interacted with workers involved in the redevelopment project of Central Vista during the inauguration event of 'Kartavya Path' in Delhi on Thursday. He told them that they will be invited to the Republic Day parade, ANI reported. PM Modi also unveiled a statue of Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose at India Gate.

250.title: PM Modi inaugurates Kartavya Path, unveils Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose's statue
250.article_body: PM Narendra Modi inaugurated the revamped Central Vista Avenue in the national capital on Thursday. Centre had recently announced that the Rajpath and Central Vista lawns area will be renamed 'Kartavya Path', which will exhibit improved public spaces and facilities including lawns with walkways and refurbished canals. He also unveiled Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose's statue near India Gate.

251.title: World's earliest evidence of surgery found in 31,000-yr-old skeleton
251.article_body: A 31,000-year-old skeleton of a young adult found in Borneo in Indonesia underwent the world's first successful surgery, researchers have found. After analysing the leg bones of the skeleton, researchers confirmed that its lower left limb had been surgically amputated. Its healed bone confirmed the injury. The skeleton was found in the 40,000-year-old caves of East Kalimantan.

252.title: Devise policy for employment of transgender persons: SC tells Centre
252.article_body: The Supreme Court on Thursday directed Centre to devise a policy aimed at providing employment to transgender persons. Centre has been asked to consult with the National Council for Transgender Persons to formulate the policy. The court was hearing a plea by a transgender woman who alleged she was refused a job at Air India owing to her gender identity.

253.title: YouTube removed 13 lakh videos in India in Q2 2022, most of any country: Report
253.article_body: YouTube removed 13.24 lakh videos in India between April-June 2022, the most among 30 countries it listed in its Community Guidelines Enforcement Report Q2 2022. This is nearly thrice more than the videos YouTube removed in the US (4.45 lakh) and Indonesia (4.27 lakh). The report further stated that YouTube removed 75.43 crore comments of which, 98.9% were flagged automatically.

254.title: B2B SaaS platform Kovai.co appoints Andrew Cloke as COO
254.article_body: Enterprise software-as-a-service (SaaS) company Kovai.co has appointed Andrew Cloke as the new Chief Operating Officer. Cloke said that he would be working out of the company's UK office and "will be making regular trips to India". Founded in 2011, Kovai.co is a Coimbatore and London-based firm, and it reported an Annual Recurring Revenue (ARR) of $10 million in 2020.

255.title: Southeast B'luru will be equipped to handle rains better: Minister
255.article_body: Karnataka IT Minister CN Ashwathnarayan on Thursday assured technology companies that by next monsoon southeast Bengaluru will be better equipped to handle severe rain. Southeast Bengaluru, which is home to several technology companies, was flooded in parts after heavy rains over the weekend. Ashwathnarayan said the government will examine implementing the ‘Elcita’ model to handle heavy rains.

256.title: Summer of 2022 was the warmest ever in Europe: Climate monitor
256.article_body: This year's summer (June-August) was the warmest in Europe's recorded history, said the European Commission's climate monitor on Thursday. The Copernicus Climate Change Service said temperatures in Europe were the "highest on record for both the month of August and the summer as a whole". As per data, this August was the warmest ever recorded by a margin of 0.4°C.

257.title: 2 shot dead, 2 injured over land dispute in Punjab's Ferozepur
257.article_body: Two persons were shot dead and two others were injured over a land dispute in Punjab's Ferozepur on Thursday. The deceased were identified as 60-year-old Balwinder Singh and 22-year-old Balraj Singh. "The two parties had been feuding over the land for two years. One of the parties, armed with guns, attempted to take forceful possession of the land," police said.

258.title: Delhi's Central Vista Avenue to have parking space for 1,117 cars
258.article_body: The new-look Central Vista Avenue will have a parking facility for 1,117 cars and nearly 35 buses. It also has designated areas for app-based taxis and auto rickshaws. Also, there will be eight new amenity blocks with new signages. These will include 64 female toilets, 32 male toilets and 10 accessible toilets for the differently abled.

259.title: Take it as responsibility, not burden: Edu Minister to students on reservations
259.article_body: Union Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan told students questioning the quota policy to take reservations as their responsibility rather than a burden. "They (disadvantaged groups) clean our washrooms, and we call them untouchables. We've been doing it for centuries," Pradhan said. "And now that...we've provided them some assistance through affirmative action, we are questioning that?" he added.

260.title: Europe unveils hi-tech satellite to give quick extreme weather warnings
260.article_body: Europe on Wednesday unveiled the MTG-I1 satellite designed to give earlier extreme weather warnings. The satellite will be launched by the end of the year on an Ariane 5 rocket. The 3.8-tonne spacecraft will be joined in geostationary orbit by three more MTG-I imaging satellites and two MTG-S "sounding" satellites. It'll start sending images from next year onwards.

261.title: Nitish, Soren & I will come together for 2024 LS elections: Mamata
261.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Thursday said that her counterparts from Bihar and Jharkhand, Nitish Kumar and Hemant Soren, will come together to oust BJP from power in the 2024 Lok Sabha elections. "All opposition parties will join hands to defeat...BJP...The [party's] arrogance of 300 seats will be its nemesis," she said while addressing a programme in Kolkata.

262.title: Bike-taxi services banned in Indore, over 1,000 such vehicles grounded
262.article_body: Citing safety and regulatory concerns, the Indore transport department has banned the operation of bike-taxis in Madhya Pradesh's biggest city, an official said on Thursday. Over 1,000 such vehicles in the city have been grounded, he added. "After an investigation into various complaints about bike-taxis, we found their operation is not safe," Regional Transport Officer Jitendra Raghwanshi said.

263.title: Minister Rajnath Singh, Japan's Hamada review defence ties
263.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh met his Japanese counterpart Yasukazu Hamada in Tokyo on Thursday, reviewing bilateral defence cooperation and regional issues. The two ministers expressed commitment to continue multilateral military exercises including 'Malabar', 'Dharma Guardian' and 'JIMEX'. Later, Singh tweeted the meeting marked 70 years of diplomatic relations between the two countries.

264.title: India announce playing XI for match against Afghanistan; Rohit, Pandya, Chahal rested
264.article_body: Afghanistan captain Mohammad Nabi won the toss and elected to bowl first in their last Asia Cup 2022 Super 4 stage match against India. India have made three changes to playing XI, with regular captain Rohit Sharma, leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal and all-rounder Hardik Pandya being replaced by Dinesh Karthik, Axar Patel and Deepak Chahar. KL Rahul will lead India today.

265.title: European Central Bank makes its largest-ever interest rate hike of 0.75%
265.article_body: The European Central Bank (ECB) made its largest-ever interest rate increase of 0.75% on Thursday. "Over the next several meetings the Governing Council expects to raise interest rates further to dampen demand and guard against...risk of...persistent upward shift in inflation expectations," the ECB said. In July, it raised interest rates for the first time in more than 11 years.

266.title: Govt to acquire Vodafone Idea stake after share price stabilises at ₹10 or above: Report
266.article_body: The government will acquire around 33% stake in debt-ridden Vodafone Idea (Vi) after the stock price of the company stabilises at ₹10 or above, Hindustan Times reported quoting official source. The company's board has reportedly offered a stake to the government at a par value of ₹10 per share. Notably, Vi shares are trading below ₹10 since April 19, 2022.

267.title: UK cinema chain Cineworld files for bankruptcy in US
267.article_body: UK-based movie theatre chain Cineworld has filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection in Texas, United States. The company has built up $4.8 billion in net debt and said that it would keep theatres open as it seeks to restructure the debt. Cineworld operates 751 movie theatres, and anticipates exiting from Chapter 11 during the first quarter of 2023.

268.title: DCW issues summons to Delhi Police over video showing children selling liquor
268.article_body: The Delhi Commission for Women on Thursday issued summons to the city police over a video purportedly showing children selling illegal liquor and ganja. "This girl is selling the same while eating ice cream. This video was reportedly recorded in Rohini. The future of children is being ruined," DCW Chief Swati Maliwal tweeted along with the video clip.

269.title: 48-yr-old man cheats DU prof of ₹34 lakh on pretext of getting VC post
269.article_body: A 48-year-old man was arrested for allegedly cheating a Delhi University professor of ₹34 lakh promising to get him the post of Vice Chancellor at Srinagar University, police said on Wednesday. The accused had met the victim a few years back and had introduced himself as an influential person in politics, the professor said in his complaint.

270.title: Fire breaks out at makeshift office outside Dubai stadium ahead of India-Afghanistan match
270.article_body: A fire broke out at a makeshift outside the Dubai International Cricket Stadium ahead of India-Afghanistan Asia Cup 2022 Super 4 stage match on Thursday. In videos that have surfaced online, fumes can be seen from inside the stadium. The fire was later doused and there won't be any affect on the match.

271.title: Latest ODI rankings released as England become world number one team
271.article_body: The ICC on Thursday released the latest ODI team rankings, with England displacing New Zealand from the top position. England are now on top with 119 rating points, while New Zealand, who have lost two ODIs in a row against Australia, are second with 117 rating points. India are the third-ranked side with 111 rating points.

272.title: NMMC demolishes under-construction illegal structure in Navi Mumbai
272.article_body: The anti-encroachment department of the Belapur ward of Navi Mumbai Municipal Corporation (NMMC) has demolished an under-construction illegal structure in Shahbaz Gaon. As per a report, the civic body had served a notice regarding the unauthorised construction at house number 600/2. NMMC carried out the demolition drive after the construction was not removed despite the notice, the report added.

273.title: 3 students killed, 1 injured after being hit by truck in Rajasthan
273.article_body: Three students on their way to appear for B Ed examination were killed and another student was injured after they were hit by a truck on the Agra-Mumbai National Highway in Rajasthan's Dholpur, police said. The students were going to the exam centre on a motorcycle and had stopped by the roadside when the truck hit them, the SHO said.

274.title: BJP MLA injured, her relative killed as car collides with truck in MP
274.article_body: BJP MLA Leena Jain was injured and her 85-year-old relative was killed after their car collided with a truck in Vidisha district, Madhya Pradesh, on Wednesday night. Four other people also sustained injuries. The car collided with the truck while trying to save a cow on the road, police said. As per reports, the deceased was Leena Jain's mother-in-law.

275.title: Cong is trying to defame 'Brand Bengaluru' for petty gains: BJP
275.article_body: BJP leader Tejasvi Surya has criticised Congress for trying to defame "Brand Bengaluru" for their "petty gains". He added that only certain parts of Bengaluru have been flooded, but the Congress is trying to suggest that the entire city is flooded. The Karnataka unit of Congress had earlier criticised Surya for eating a dosa, while other citizens were struggling.

276.title: 35-yr-old Mumbai man held for siphoning off 1,850 iPhones worth ₹11 cr
276.article_body: A 35-year-old former employee of a Mumbai-based authorised Apple distributor, Manish Pujari, was arrested for allegedly siphoning off 1,850 iPhones worth ₹11.13 crore. Pujari surrendered after he was booked based on the complaint by Ingram Micro India Pvt Ltd. "Pujari was given the responsibility of developing relationships with the client and expanding business with them," an official said.

277.title: IT, BT firms also responsible for flood situation in B'luru: BJP leader
277.article_body: BJP leader NR Ramesh said information technology (IT) and business technology (BT) firms are also responsible for the flood situation in Bengaluru. Companies in Electronics City have encroached upon storm water drains completely or narrowed them, Ramesh said. He added that firms are threatening Karnataka government that they'll shift to Telangana. They won't survive there for a day, Ramesh said.

278.title: Indian and Chinese troops begin disengagement from Gogra-Hot Springs in Ladakh
278.article_body: Indian and Chinese troops have started withdrawing from Gogra-Hot Springs Patrolling Point-15 in Ladakh after reaching a consensus in the 16th round of military talks, the two sides said in a joint statement. This is "conducive to peace and tranquility in the border areas", the statement said. The 16th round of India-China Corps Commander level talks were held in July.

279.title: OPS has betrayed the party, he's like a chameleon: AIADMK's EPS
279.article_body: Former Tamil Nadu CM and AIADMK leader Edappadi K Palaniswami on Thursday criticised his party colleague O Panneerselvam. "He has betrayed the party. OPS is like a chameleon," EPS said. "OPS had led...violence at party HQ, how can the party cadre accept his return?" EPS said, adding elections will be held for the post of party's general secretary soon.

280.title: Allu Arjun did look trial; shoot begins by Sept 22: Pushpa 2 producer
280.article_body: 'Pushpa: The Rule' producer Y Ravi Shankar said Allu Arjun did his look trial earlier this week for the upcoming Sukumar directorial. He informed that while Arjun's look will continue to be rustic, there will be a little change as compared to his look in 'Pushpa: The Rise'. Shankar added the film's shooting will start around September 22 in Hyderabad.

281.title: BJP only party with internal democracy: JP Nadda to foreign diplomats
281.article_body: BJP chief JP Nadda on Wednesday told the foreign diplomats that BJP is the only political party in India with strong internal democracy and ideology. He added, "All posts in the party, from...president to the national president, are elected via elections within the party, and it is the only political organisation to never compromise on its ideology and principles."

282.title: PMC to charge property tax based on amenities in housing societies
282.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has reportedly decided to levy the property tax as per the facilities and price of flats in housing societies. The move would affect over 80,000 houses in the city. "The more luxurious the facility, the higher the tax," Municipal Commissioner Vikram Kumar said. This is reportedly being done only as part of a pilot study.

283.title: B'desh PM Hasina dances with local artists in Jaipur, video surfaces
283.article_body: Bangladesh PM Sheikh Hasina danced with the local artists, who had gathered at Jaipur Airport to welcome her to Rajasthan on Thursday. PM Hasina, who is on her four-day visit to India, visited the Ajmer Sharif Dargah today. She and her delegation reached the Jaipur International Airport by a special aircraft and were received by State Education Minister BD Kalla.

284.title: Hyderabad man given 20 yrs imprisonment for sodomising teenager
284.article_body: A 32-year-old cable TV technician in Hyderabad was sentenced to 20 years of imprisonment, by a local court, for sodomising a teenager in 2018. The man befriended the 16-year-old boy from his locality and assaulted him at his home when he was delivering some goods, the police said. The victim was sent for a medical examination and given counselling.

285.title: Video shows people carrying dead body through flood water in Maha
285.article_body: A video has emerged online showing a group of people carrying a dead body on their shoulders through flood water for cremation in Yavatmal, Maharashtra. People were seen wading through waist-deep water. This comes amid heavy rains in the region. Many areas in Maharashtra including Thane, Mumbai and Yavatmal have received a yellow alert from India Meteorological Department till Sunday.

286.title: Amit Mishra trolls Pakistani actress Sehar Shinwari over her 'cow dung' tweet
286.article_body: Veteran cricketer Amit Mishra trolled Pakistani actress Sehar Shinwari after she mocked him over his "Will eat Afghani chaap whole week if Afghanistan defeats Pakistan...Fingers crossed" tweet. "Awwww poor mishra will have to spend whole week on Cow Dung," Sehar wrote after Pakistan beat Afghanistan. Trolling Sehar, Mishra replied, "No, I have no plans of coming to Pakistan."

287.title: Doctors of Queen Elizabeth II concerned for her health, says Buckingham Palace
287.article_body: Queen Elizabeth II's doctors are "concerned" for her health and recommended she "remain under medical supervision", Buckingham Palace said on Thursday. The Queen remains comfortable and at Balmoral, the statement further said. The announcement comes a day after the 96-year-old monarch cancelled a meeting of her Privy Council.

288.title: Mumbai boy sets self ablaze as girlfriend's parents reject marriage proposal
288.article_body: A 19-year-old college student allegedly set himself on fire after his girlfriend's parents rejected his marriage proposal, police said. The boy also live-streamed the act on social media. As per reports, he was also depressed after he saw a video of his girlfriend slitting her wrist. The boy suffered 10% burns, while the girl has been administered medical treatment.

289.title: Man uses National Flag to clean scooty, arrested by Delhi Police
289.article_body: Delhi Police has arrested a man for allegedly cleaning his scooty using the National Flag. Police registered a case against the accused when a video of the incident surfaced online, in which he can be seen cleaning the dust off using the tricolour. The vehicle has been seized by the police and the flag has also been recovered.

290.title: TSRTC to provide 565 special buses for Ganesh immersion in Hyd
290.article_body: The Telangana State Road Transport Corporation (TSRTC) announced 565 special buses in Hyderabad for the Ganesh immersion ceremony on September 9. The buses will also be ferried after midnight on Friday and TSRTC information kiosks have been set up at NTR Marg, Gandhi Marg outpost and Metro control room, Basheerbagh. The buses are provided so people can reach Tank Bund.

291.title: Tesla triples China-made car sales after Shanghai plant revamp
291.article_body: Tesla sold 76,965 Chinese-made vehicles in August as against 28,217 vehicles in July after it quickened deliveries following the output revamp at its Shanghai plant. While Tesla exported 42,463 Model 3s and Model Ys from China last month, it had exported 19,756 units in July, China Passenger Car Association (CPCA) said. China's overall passenger car sales in August jumped 28.4%.

292.title: New Apple iPhone will be available in Russia, says Russian minister
292.article_body: Russian Trade and Industry Minister Denis Manturov said that Russians will be able to buy the new Apple iPhone 14. The US tech giant left Russia after the country announced a scheme authorising retailers to import products from abroad without the trademark owner's permission. After the Russian invasion of Ukraine began, Apple halted sale of its new products in Russia.

293.title: It's display of love: NC leader on 'beautification' of terrorist Yakub Memon's grave
293.article_body: National Conference leader Mustafa Kamal said 'beautification' of 1993 Mumbai bombings convict Yakub Memon's grave is a "display of love". "[The beautification] neither weakens religion, nor is it wrong...Those who were pained will give themselves to this grave," Kamal said. "It isn't wrong for us to remember those who worked for us, helped us, took care of us," he added.

294.title: UK PM Liz Truss caps consumer energy bills for 2 years at £2,500/year
294.article_body: British Prime Minister Liz Truss capped consumer power bills for two years at £2,500 a year on Thursday. However, Truss did not put a price on the package. Deutsche Bank estimated that the energy price offset along with Truss' promised tax cuts could cost £179 billion. Energy prices were soaring in UK due to the Russia-Ukraine war and COVID-19 aftershocks.

295.title: Need restrictive monetary policies for some time: US Fed Vice Chair
295.article_body: US Federal Reserve Vice Chair Lael Brainard said monetary policies need to be restrictive for "some time" for the inflation to move down towards the target. She said the policy rate will need to rise further. The time for the inflation to back down to 2% will depend on continued easing in supply constraints and slower demand growth, Brainard added.

296.title: Garba a medium of 'love jihad', people must bring their IDs: MP Minister
296.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Culture Minister Usha Thakur has said that the Garba pandals, usually organised during Navratri, have become a medium of 'love jihad'. "Anyone who comes to the Garba should bring their identity card. No one can enter the Garba without identification. This is also advice and an admonition for all," she said.

297.title: Incident like Sonali Phogat's death shouldn't be linked to tourism: Goa minister
297.article_body: The incident like BJP leader Sonali Phogat's death should not be linked to the tourism industry and its prospects, Goa Tourism Minister Rohan Khaunte said on Thursday. "The police department is investigating Phogat's death. Let the investigation reveal the truth behind her death," he added. Meanwhile, Goa CM Pramod Sawant said the probe into the matter is on right track.

298.title: Karza Technologies Co-founder buys ₹70 cr home in Mumbai: Report
298.article_body:
Co-founder of Karza Technologies, Gaurav Samdaria, has bought a ₹70 crore sea-facing duplex in Mumbai's tony Worli Sea Face, as per a report. The apartment is in the Legacy building on Khan Abdul Gaffar Khan Road and was sold by Sachiv Sahni to the startup Co-founder. Earlier in March, 
Bengaluru-based Perfios Software Solutions bought Karza Technologies for around ₹600 crore.

299.title: US approves potential sale of F-16 equipment to Pak in $450-million deal
299.article_body: The US State Department has approved the potential sale of F-16 aircraft sustainment and related equipment to Pakistan in a deal valued at up to $450 million. This is the first major security assistance to Pakistan after Donald Trump in 2018 stopped all defence and security assistance to Pakistan alleging that Islamabad wasn't a partner in its fight against terrorism.

300.title: Investigation is on right track: Goa CM on Sonali Phogat death case
300.article_body: Goa CM Pramod Sawant on Wednesday said that he has full faith in the state police department that is investigating BJP leader Sonali Phogat’s death case. "The investigation...is on the right track," CM Sawant added. "At present, I don’t want to discuss any investigation about this case," he stated.

301.title: PM's harebrained schemes have weakened us: Asaduddin Owaisi
301.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi criticised Prime Minister Narendra Modi for his defence policies and said that India is running short of weapons in its fight against neighbouring country China. "PM's harebrained schemes have weakened us. India's biggest challenge is China...We're going to be short of HUNDREDS of jets. Too bad WEAK PM Modi can't blame Mughals for it," he tweeted.

302.title: Greenpeace ranks Toyota lowest in study on decarbonisation efforts
302.article_body: Greenpeace has ranked Japanese automakers Toyota, Honda, and Nissan at the bottom in a study on automakers' decarbonisation efforts. Greenpeace ranked Toyota last out of 10 automakers, highlighting that zero-emission vehicles made up less than 1% of company's sales. Last week, Toyota said it would invest up to $5.1 billion in Japan and the US to make electric vehicle batteries.

303.title: Powerplay raises $7.14 mn in Series A led by Accel, Sequoia Surge
303.article_body: Construction management platform Powerplay has raised $7.14 million in its Series A funding round led by Accel and Sequoia Surge. India Quotient, and Snapdeal founders Kunal Bahl and Rohit Bansal also participated in the round. Powerplay was founded by Iesh Dixit and Shubham Goyal in 2020, and claims 3 times growth in its operating system (OS) business compared to 2021.

304.title: Congress & Rahul have done work of breaking country: Union Minister
304.article_body: The Congress and Rahul Gandhi have done the work of breaking the country, Union Minister Kiren Rijiju said on Thursday. "You listen to Rahul Gandhi, he only talks about disintegrating every state on the basis of language, religion and many more," Rijiju added. On Wednesday, Rijiju had tweeted, "His (Rahul) party assaulted every institution of India including judiciary."

305.title: Delhi HC waives off cost of ₹25,000 imposed on ex-CBI chief Nageswara Rao
305.article_body: Delhi High Court has waived off the cost of ₹25,000 imposed on M Nageswara Rao, the former CBI chief and retired IPS officer. The High Court had imposed the cost while dismissing his plea over a Twitter verified tag. Earlier, the petition stated that the verification tag from the Twitter account was removed on March 16, 2022.

306.title: River, dry for 30 years, floods Bengaluru following weekend rains
306.article_body: The Dakshina Pinakini River, which was dry for 30 years, overflowed and flooded parts of Bengaluru on Wednesday following heavy rains over the weekend. The Channasandra Main Road was flooded under 4 feet water after the river overflowed. The Channasandra Main Road, which starts from Hope Farm Junction to Koralur and joins Hoskote to Malur, witnessed severe traffic congestion.

307.title: Canara Bank increases lending rate by up to 0.15%, EMIs to go up
307.article_body: Canara Bank increased its marginal cost of funds-based lending rate (MCLR) by up to 0.15% or 15 basis points across all tenors. The revised rates have come into effect from September 7. With the increase, EMIs for housing, vehicles and personal loans will go up for those borrowers who availed of loans on MCLR. One-year MCLR will now be 7.75%.

308.title: Security guard electrocuted to death in flooded basement in B'luru
308.article_body: A security guard died after he was electrocuted in a flooded basement in Bengaluru. The incident occurred when the deceased was trying to start a generator in the basement of Hulkul Ascent apartment. The victim's elder brother has filed a complaint, stating the basement was completely filled with water and held the building owner and employer responsible for the death.

309.title: Benzema sidelined for a month after injury during Madrid's win over Celtic
309.article_body: Real Madrid striker Karim Benzema is reportedly set to be sidelined for a month due to injuries he sustained during Real Madrid's Champions League win against Celtic. Benzema was substituted after 30 minutes during the match, which Madrid won 3-0. As per Real Madrid's medical report, Benzema injured the semitendinosus tendon and strained the quadriceps muscle in his right thigh.

310.title: Google pilot to allow daily fantasy sports, rummy games on Play Store in India
310.article_body: As part of a pilot project being undertaken by Google, daily fantasy sports and rummy games apps will be available on Play Store in India starting September 28. Applicants that are accepted to participate in the pilot will be eligible to distribute their apps to users in India, Google said. Apps failing to meet guidelines will be removed, it added.

311.title: Am I their bonded labour?: Mamata on being called for Netaji statue inauguration
311.article_body: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Thursday criticised central government saying that she feels bad that they're now making a Netaji statue in Delhi. "What about the statue present before? I received letter from an under secretary stating PM will inaugurate the statue today and you be there before the event commences. Am I their bonded labour?" she said.

312.title: Singtel entities offload 1.76% stake in Bharti Airtel: Report
312.article_body: Singapore Telecommunications (Singtel) entities have offloaded a 1.76% stake in Bharti Airtel for ₹7,128 crore, sources said. Bharti Airtel promoter Bharti Telecom has bought a 1.63% stake from Pastel for ₹6,602 crore through an open market transaction. Viridian also reportedly offloaded about 1 crore shares. Following this, public shareholding in Bharti Airtel will rise to 44.87% from 44.74%.

313.title: I respect PM Modi for courage to buy discounted Russian oil amid global pressure: FM
313.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman praised PM Narendra Modi for his courage to permit the purchase of discounted Russian oil amid global pressure. She added, "India's entire import had 2% of the Russian component, and it was ramped up to 12-13% within a couple of months." I give credit to his statesmanship for keeping ties with other countries intact, she said.

314.title: Automobile retail sales in India surge by 8.31% in August: FADA
314.article_body: Retail sales of automobiles in India surged by 8.31% to 15,21,490 units in August 2022 as against 14,04,704 units in August 2021, the Federation of Automobile Dealers Associations (FADA) said on Thursday. This was driven by an increase in registrations of vehicles across all major segments. Retail sales of two-wheelers also grew by 8.52% to 10,74,266 units this August.

315.title: Decomposed bodies of Bengal couple in 20s found in Chennai lodge
315.article_body: Decomposed bodies of a couple from West Bengal were found in a lodge in Chennai on Wednesday, said police. The victims, 24-year-old Prasenjit Gosh and 20-year-old Arpita Pal, had booked a room on Saturday. Police were called in after a lodge staffer noticed a foul smell coming from the locked room. The couple were found dead on the bed.

316.title: B'luru hotels offer rooms at discounted prices for flood affected
316.article_body: Bengaluru hotels on Wednesday said that they will offer rooms at discounted prices for people whose homes have been affected by heavy rains in the last few days. The Bruhath Bangalore Hotels Association (BBHA) made the offer after reports emerged stating that hotels were exploiting the situation by hiking the prices of the rooms.

317.title: Fallen soldier's family refuses to accept Shaurya Chakra sent by courier
317.article_body: A fallen soldier's family has refused to accept the Shaurya Chakra which arrived at their home in Gujarat by courier. "It must be conferred by the President," Lance Naik Gopal Singh Bhadoriya's father said. The award was approved in 2018. However, it was delayed amid a dispute between Gopal's estranged wife and his parents over who would receive the award.

318.title: Cricket betting racket busted in Hyd, materials worth ₹20 lakh seized
318.article_body: The Rachakonda Special Operations Team along with the Saroornagar Police raided a gaming house in Hyderabad and busted a cricket betting racket on Wednesday and arrested two persons. The officials also seized material worth ₹20.5 lakh, including cash and mobile phones. The accused were identified as T Ashok, a bookie from Saroornagar, and M Kishore, a bookie from Yacharam.

319.title: BMC fills 2,000 potholes in 10 days for smooth Ganpati Visarjan
319.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has fixed 2,000 potholes in the last 10 days, 200 on average each day, to ensure smooth and hassle-free Ganpati Visarjan processions in Mumbai. The areas with the most potholes reportedly were Andheri, Ghatkopar, Jogeshwari, Goregaon and Malad. The Ganesh mandals have praised BMC for their quick road repairs.

320.title: Schneider Electric Infra shares surge 14% to hit 52-week high
320.article_body: Schneider Electric Infrastructure's shares surged by 14% on Thursday to hit a new 52-week high of ₹167.85 on the NSE after the company's board gave a nod to setting up a manufacturing unit in Kolkata. In the first quarter of FY23, it reported a profit of ₹26.5 crore against a loss of ₹16.08 crore in the corresponding period last year.

321.title: Pics show 'beautified' grave of terrorist Yakub Memon with LED lighting; probe ordered
321.article_body: The Mumbai Police removed the LED lights around terrorist Yakub Memon's grave at Bada Kabarastan on Thursday. The action was taken after videos and pictures of Memon's grave that was 'beautified' with marble tiles, halogen and LED lights were circulated on social media, police said. The Maharashtra government has also asked Mumbai Police to conduct a detailed probe.

322.title: UP woman gets obscene messages as husband shares her number with 30 friends
322.article_body: In a bid to take revenge on his wife for filing dowry harassment case against him, a man in Uttar Pradesh's Kanpur reportedly shared her WhatsApp number with his 30 friends. The accused allegedly asked them to send obscene texts, photos and videos to his wife. The woman alleged her husband did this to pressurise her to withdraw the case.

323.title: 8,000 police personnel to be deployed for Ganesh Visarjan in Pune
323.article_body: About 8,000 police personnel would reportedly be deployed across Pune to ensure the smooth conduct of immersion of the idols of Lord Ganesha for the Ganpati Visarjan on Friday. The deployment will be headed by Police Commissioner Amitabh Gupta. Officials said the entire staff of the traffic control branch would be on the roads to man the traffic and processions.

324.title: 7 passengers held at Hyd airport, cigarettes worth ₹11 lakh seized
324.article_body: Customs officials at Hyderabad airport arrested seven passengers for allegedly trying to smuggle cigarettes and 100 e-cigarettes worth ₹11 lakh. On suspicion, the officials checked the baggage of passengers travelling to India from Bahrain and Dubai and found they were carrying the cigarettes illegally. "The goods have been confiscated," Hyderabad Customs tweeted.

325.title: CJI-led SC bench to hear pleas challenging CAA on September 12
325.article_body: The Supreme Court is set to hear petitions challenging the Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA) on September 12. A bench of Chief Justice of India UU Lalit and Justice S Ravindra Bhat will hear the matter. The Kerala government, TMC MP Mahua Moitra, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi and Congress' Jairam Ramesh are among those who have challenged the Act.

326.title: 45-yr-old Thane man gets life imprisonment for raping minor relative
326.article_body: A special court in Thane has sentenced a 45-year-old man to life imprisonment for raping his brother-in-law's minor daughter. The court also imposed a fine of ₹10,000 on the accused. The accused raped the minor multiple times between July 2016 and December 2017 when the 16-year-old victim lived with her grandmother in Thane, special public prosecutor told the court.

327.title: Request parties to unite to bring Netaji's remains to India: Bose's daughter
327.article_body: Freedom fighter Subhas Chandra Bose's daughter urged political parties in the country to work together for bringing Netaji's remains to India. "It was my father's ambition to experience a free India. Tragically, his untimely death denied him this wish. I feel his remains should at least touch the soil of India and bring closure to the matter," she said.

328.title: Demolition of Pune's Chandani chowk old bridge to begin on Sept 9
328.article_body: The demolition of the old bridge at Pune's Chandani chowk will begin on September 9, National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) Pune project head Sanjay Kadam said. "Initially...planning and drilling part will be carried out by the team with the support of the NHAI and district administration," he added. A traffic block of 'nine to 10 hours' will be implemented.

329.title: Marvel film would be so fun: Kim Kardashian on whether she'd act
329.article_body: Kim Kardashian expressed that she would love to act if she is offered something like a Marvel film. "Would I act? I would if something fun came about. Maybe a Marvel movie, that would be so fun to do," she said. However, she mentioned that she is not actively looking for an acting project.

330.title: Centre didn't invite me to be part of Sheikh Hasina's visit to India: Mamata
330.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Thursday said that the Centre did not invite her to be a part of Bangladesh PM Sheikh Hasina's visit to India. "I share a very good relationship with…Sheikh Hasina…This is the first time the PM of Bangladesh came to India and did not come to Bengal despite her desire to meet me," Banerjee added.

331.title: Boycott calls are more aggressive for 'Brahmastra': Taran Adarsh
331.article_body: Film trade analyst Taran Adarsh said boycott calls against Ranbir Kapoor-starrer 'Brahmastra' are "more aggressive". "But I've always maintained...be it IPL, weather conditions, examination or boycott calls, nothing can harm a film if the content is strong," he added. Speaking about 'Laal Singh Chaddha', Taran said the 'boycott' trend became "sharper" as the film's content was weak.

332.title: This one will hurt for a while: Sinner after losing to Alcaraz in US Open
332.article_body: Italian tennis player Jannik Sinner said his defeat against Carlos Alcaraz in the US Open quarter-finals "will hurt for a while". "I had some tough losses...[but] this is in the top list...it was a good match for sure. But a very, very tough one," he added. Alcaraz defeated Sinner with a scoreline of 6-3, 6-7(7-9), 6-7(0-7), 7-5, 6-3.

333.title: No FTA with Israel until pact is mutually beneficial: Goyal
333.article_body: Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal said that India will not ink a free trade agreement (FTA) with Israel until it gets a good deal, adding that the pact has to be "reciprocally beneficial". With a bilateral annual trade of nearly $8 billion, India and Israel have been engaged in FTA negotiations since May 2010, however, haven't been successful yet.

334.title: 'Didn't get the job?' UK job search company in ad featuring Sunak as he loses UK PM race
334.article_body: After Liz Truss defeated Rishi Sunak in the race to become the next UK PM, a UK job search company mocked Sunak with an advertisement. It showed his picture alongside text that said, "Didn't get the job? We've got jobs for everyone. Find one that works for you." "Ouch!! The British humour remains as savage as ever!" a person tweeted.

335.title: Actor Ajay Devgn shares his 1st look as Chitragupt from 'Thank God'
335.article_body: Actor Ajay Devgn took to Instagram and shared his first look from 'Thank God'. Along with the look, Ajay wrote, "This Diwali, Chitragupt is coming to play the game of life with you and your family!" Rakul Preet Singh and Sidharth Malhotra will also feature in the film. The film, directed by Indra Kumar, will release on October 25.

336.title: SBI misreads Kannada numeral written on cheque, dishonours it; fined ₹85,177
336.article_body: A State Bank of India branch in Karnataka's Haliyal has been fined ₹85,177 by the Consumer Forum for dishonouring a cheque after failing to recognise a Kannada numeral written on it. Vadirajacharya Inamdar had issued a cheque for ₹6,000 towards his electricity bill on September 3, 2020. The branch had wrongly identified the Kannada numeral nine (for September) as six.

337.title: Highway construction can be done in a way to aid building new lakes: Gadkari
337.article_body: Road Transport and Highways Minister Nitin Gadkari on Thursday said his Ministry can help address the water woes in India. Highway construction requires soil, which can be obtained in a manner that new water bodies can be formed, Gadkari said. "There's no dearth of water but water management (is an issue). We can use highways for building lakes," he added.

338.title: Rules must be followed: Mumbai Traffic Police to conduct seatbelt awareness drive
338.article_body: Calling the car accident of businessman Cyrus Mistry "an eye opener", Mumbai Traffic Police said it will conduct an awareness drive to spread the importance of wearing front and rear seat belts in vehicles. "Rules must be followed. It's compulsory for...drivers to ask the passengers to wear their seat belts. If not found, we'll penalise...taxi drivers," a police official said.

339.title: IIM dropout among 7 held by Delhi Police for smuggling drugs via dark net
339.article_body: The Delhi Police Crime Branch has arrested seven people, including an IIM dropout and a fashion designer, for allegedly smuggling drugs with the help of the dark net, police said on Thursday. In three different operations, the police seized over 28 blotting papers of LSD, 12.6 gram of MDMA, 84 gram of curated marijuana and 220 gram of hashish.

340.title: DMRC to provide electric bus services for Central Vista visitors
340.article_body: Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) will provide electric bus services to people wanting to visit India Gate and the new Central Vista Avenue from Friday onwards, officials said. The visitors would be able to board these buses from Bhairon Road from 5 pm-9 pm. DMRC said this facility will be available initially for a week and may be extended further.

341.title: Bengaluru's Bellandur road is now safe to travel for commuters: Police
341.article_body: The Bengaluru Traffic Police today said that it is safe for commuters to travel through Bellandur as waterflow has come down in the area. Bellandur was reportedly one of the most affected areas due to severe waterlogging. Earlier many vehicles were stuck on this stretch of Bengaluru and police urged people to avoid travelling on Outer Ring Road (ORR).

342.title: Draft data anonymisation rules taken down from IT Ministry's website
342.article_body: The Guidelines for Anonymisation of Data were taken down from the IT Ministry's website on Tuesday, about one week after they were put up for public feedback. They were reportedly taken down to send them for ministerial evaluation. Anonymisation refers to the removal or modification of data, such as Aadhaar numbers, so that individuals can't be identified from it.

343.title: Woman fights phone snatcher in Delhi; incident caught on camera
343.article_body: A woman fought off a phone snatcher while going to visit her friend in Delhi's Badarpur area, police said. The incident was caught on CCTV camera wherein the man can be seen hitting her as she grabs onto his t-shirt. The woman had caught the thief by his shirt but he ran away after the phone fell down, police added.

344.title: Man cracks 'bomb in bag' joke at Indore airport; quizzed, searched
344.article_body: A family of three had to undergo intense questioning after a man, while undergoing a security check at Indore's Devi Ahilya Bai Holkar Airport, joked about a bomb in his bag. The man apologised for his behaviour during questioning, said Airport Director CV Ravindran, adding that the family missed their flight because of the incident.

345.title: Man arrested for harassing lions, chasing them on bike in Gujarat
345.article_body: A 25-year-old man has been arrested for allegedly harassing Asiatic lions in Gujarat's Gir forest by chasing them on his bike. The accused, Devku Mobh from Amreli district, posted a video on social media which showed him harassing lions and other wild animals, said police. Officials have seized a bike and a mobile phone from the man.

346.title: We did talk about another 'Forrest Gump': Tom Hanks
346.article_body: Actor Tom Hanks revealed that the makers of 'Forrest Gump' had thought of a sequel. However, the conversation lasted only for 40 minutes and the idea never took off. Hanks said he did a "smart thing" to not sign a contract that had a contractual obligation to a sequel. He said there should be a reason to do a sequel.

347.title: Delhi man fires shots during b'day party, arrested as video goes viral
347.article_body: Delhi Police have arrested a man and his two friends for firing in the air during a birthday party in the Shastri Park area. The arrest took place after a video of the celebratory firing went viral on social media, showing the accused pulling out a pistol and firing in the air. The weapon used in firing was reportedly illegal.

348.title: Conversation with friend helped: Big B on how he dealt with father's death
