348.article_body: Amitabh Bachchan remembered a friend's conversation that helped him cope with his father Harivansh Rai Bachchan's death. He recalled that when he was upset, his friend asked him to be happy about spending over 60 years with his father. "He then said that he was able to spend only 25. This helped me realise the importance of elders," he said.

349.title: Will slow down when my body tells me naturally: Bhumi Pednekar
349.article_body: Speaking about her hectic schedule, actress Bhumi Pednekar has said that she has not got much of her "me-time" this year. "I feel me-time is...important...It's...revenge work that I'm doing for the time that we lost in COVID-19," she added. Bhumi stated, "When naturally my body will tell me...I'll only then slow down. But at the moment...I'm having a blast."

350.title: Pant might be dropped: Uthappa on India's likely XI against Afghanistan
350.article_body: Talking about possible changes in India's playing XI against Afghanistan in their Asia Cup match today, Robin Uthappa said Dinesh Karthik might be included in the XI. "I feel Rishabh Pant might be dropped and Deepak Hooda will bat at number five," he stated. "In bowling, I think Deepak Chahar will play," added Uthappa.

351.title: Kids made to clean toilet in UP school, probe on after video surfaces
351.article_body: A purported video showing students of a primary school in the Sohaon area of UP's Ballia being forced to clean a toilet has surfaced on social media. A man reportedly scolded the children and threatened to lock the toilet if they did not obey. Basic Education Officer Maniram Singh said that a probe has been ordered into the incident.

352.title: More BJP talks about 'Bharat Jodo Yatra', it's evident they're rattled: Jairam
352.article_body: Congress' Jairam Ramesh said the more BJP talks about 'Bharat Jodo Yatra', the more it is evident that the party is "rattled". "I'm 100% sure 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' is 'sanjivani' for Congress, it is a lifesaver...it will renew the party," Ramesh added. "Cong after 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' will be the party that cannot be taken for granted," he stated.

353.title: France drops probe into its troops' complicity during 1994 Rwandan genocide
353.article_body: French judges have dropped a case against French peacekeepers who were accused of being complicit during 1994 Rwanda genocide. In a statement, French Public Prosecutor's office said they found nothing that would indicate French military forces' direct participation in abuses committed in refugee camps. Genocide survivors accused French soldiers of deliberately abandoning them to Hutus extremists.

354.title: Ukraine's top general warns of threat of Russia using nuclear weapons
354.article_body: Valeriy Zaluzhnyi, Commander-in-Chief of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, warned of the threat of Russia using nuclear weapons in Ukraine. In an article, co-authored by lawmaker Mykhailo Zabrodskyi, Zaluzhnyi said it is impossible to rule out direct involvement of the world's leading countries in a "limited" nuclear conflict. Russia has denied the use of nuclear or chemical weapons in Ukraine.

355.title: 19-yr-old girl from Chennai dies by suicide after failing NEET-UG exam
355.article_body: A 19-year-old Chennai student allegedly died by suicide after she failed to clear the National Eligibility Entrance Test (NEET-UG). She is a second-year medical student in the Philippines and took the NEET to study in India. "After the exam got over in July, we've been providing mental health counselling to students through 210 counsellors," Tamil Nadu minister Ma Subramanian said.

356.title: Kejriwal govt imposing ban on crackers in Delhi to appease Muslims: BJP
356.article_body: BJP has accused AAP of "hurting Hindu sentiments" by banning firecrackers in Delhi ahead of Diwali and Dussehra festivals. "This decision has been taken to appease Muslims in Gujarat. This is not an issue related to pollution. It is an attempt to stop Hindu festivals," BJP leader Kapil Mishra said. "People will not obey such an unscientific order," he added.

357.title: Video shows primary students cleaning school toilet in UP, probe ordered
357.article_body: Ballia's Basic Education Officer Maniram Singh on Thursday said that he has ordered a probe after a clip purportedly showing students being forced to clean toilets at a district primary school surfaced on social media. In the video, a man can be seen scolding the students and threatening to lock the toilet if the students don't do as asked.

358.title: Old pic shows former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry having meal at dhaba with his driver
358.article_body: An old photo showing former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry, who died in a car crash on Sunday, having a meal at a dhaba with his driver has resurfaced. The photo shows Mistry having the meal in a traditional setting while sitting on a cot. The picture was reportedly taken during a road trip, according to a Facebook post.

359.title: Steve Jobs' wife, Tim Cook launch online archive dedicated to him
359.article_body: Apple Co-founder Steve Jobs' wife Laurene Powell Jobs, Apple CEO Tim Cook, and former design chief Jony Ive came together at the CodeCon 2022 to launch an online archive dedicated to Jobs. The online archive features historical materials related to Jobs, including content never seen by the public until now. It also shares some notable quotes from Jobs.

360.title: Lido files for bankruptcy, 6 months after asking 1,200 employees to resign
360.article_body: Ronnie Screwvala-backed edtech startup Lido Learning has filed for insolvency and bankruptcy. This comes almost six months after reports of the company shutting its operations and asking about 1,200 employees to resign amid a cash crunch. According to the company's filings, Lido failed to pay off its debts payable to its former employees, customers, vendors, lenders and other creditors.

361.title: Deepika, Kriti, Shraddha among frontrunners for 'Aashiqui 3': Report
361.article_body: Actresses Deepika Padukone, Kriti Sanon and Shraddha Kapoor are reportedly frontrunners for playing the female lead in Anurag Basu's 'Aashiqui 3' alongside actor Kartik Aaryan. "As we speak, the team is in the process of locking the cast...also giving those final touches to the script," a source close to the development told Pinkvilla. Shraddha had featured in 'Aashiqui 2'.

362.title: Fast local trains to halt at all stations between Mumbai Central, Churchgate tomorrow
362.article_body: The Western Railway announced that all fast local trains, which run from 5 pm to 8.30 pm towards Churchgate, will be provided halts at all stations between Mumbai Central and Churchgate on Friday due to Ganpati Visarjan. Additionally, Western Railway has also decided to run eight Ganpati special locals during midnight of September 9-10 between Churchgate and Virar stations.

363.title: Businessman Atulya Mafatlal passes away in Mumbai aged 60
363.article_body: Businessman Atulya Mafatlal reportedly died in his sleep early on Wednesday morning at Mafatlal House in Mumbai's Altamount Road, aged 60. He'd woken up at around 4 am feeling uneasy but eventually went back to sleep, his friend informed. When he didn't wake up in the morning, he was taken to Breach Candy Hospital, where doctors declared him brought dead.

364.title: Will you consider Shami, Chahar & where does Karthik stand: Jaffer
364.article_body: With India crashing out of the race for Asia Cup 2022 final, ex-India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said Team India has the quality but they're not playing with the right combination. "T20 WC squad will soon be announced, and with what combination you will play. Will you consider Mohammad Shami, Deepak Chahar, and where does Dinesh Karthik stand?" asked Jaffer.

365.title: 25-yr-old man arrested for stealing gym equipment in Chandigarh
365.article_body: A 25-year-old man was arrested for allegedly stealing weight plates and other gym equipment from a vacant plot in Chandigarh. According to the complainant, the theft took place on the intervening night of September 4 and 5. The accused was arrested while he was going to sell the gym plates to a scrap dealer in an auto, police said.

366.title: PM Modi is a great guy, his job is not easy: Donald Trump
366.article_body: In an interview with NDTV, former US President Donald Trump praised Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi and said, "It is not an easy job he (PM Modi) has got." "I've had a great relationship with India and with Prime Minister Modi. We've been friends. And I think he's a great guy and doing a terrific job," he added.

367.title: Kapiva releases user stories of losing over 10 kgs with Get Slim Juice
367.article_body: In videos shared by Kapiva, Kavitha shared she lost 13 kgs, while Tritoy said he lost 24 kgs he gained after spondylitis, and Akanksha shared she lost 13 kgs in 6 months. Kapiva reported that Get Slim Juice, with 12 Ayurvedic herbs, was deemed effective by 90% of users. Kapiva also provides free diet and yoga plans with doctor consultation.

368.title: Buy your mom an iPhone: Tim Cook to user who complained about iOS-Android texting
368.article_body: Responding to an audience member at a conference, who said he couldn’t send his mother videos on her Android phone because of restrictions on iPhone SMS messaging, Apple CEO Tim Cook said, "Buy your mom an iPhone." Cook added, Apple doesn't spend a lot of effort improving the iPhone-Android texting experience as its users haven't asked for it.

369.title: It's a pleasure working with Gerard Butler, we're very similar: Elnaaz
369.article_body: Speaking about working with actor Gerard Butler in the Hollywood film 'Kandahar', actress Elnaaz Norouzi has said that he is a "fantastic" human being. "It's a great pleasure working with him...He's super fun and we're very similar, we're both crazy," Elnaaz added. "Being a part of such a big movie which has Gerard makes me feel really good," she stated.

370.title: Russia interrogated, detained, forcibly deported many Ukrainians: US
370.article_body: The US said it has found evidence that Moscow interrogated, detained and forcibly deported hundreds of thousands of Ukrainians to Russia. During a Security Council meeting called by the US and Albania, it was highlighted that Russia's "filtration operations" included data collection, strip searches and torture. Russia dismissed allegations as "fantasy" and disinformation campaign.

371.title: NASA selects Axiom Space to make spacesuit for 2025 Moon walk
371.article_body: NASA has selected Axiom Space to deliver a moonwalking system including advanced spacesuits for the Artemis III Moon mission in 2025. The task order has a base value of $228.5 million. Artemis III will be the first mission of NASA's new Artemis program to land astronauts on the Moon, including the first woman and the first person of colour.

372.title: 19-yr-old Alcaraz beats Sinner in 2nd-longest match in US Open history, enters semis
372.article_body: Spain's 19-year-old Carlos Alcaraz has entered the semi-finals at the US Open after defeating Italian Jannik Sinner. Alcaraz won with a scoreline of 6-3, 6-7(7-9), 6-7(0-7), 7-5, 6-3 in the quarter-final that lasted five-hour and 15 minutes, the second-longest match in the tournament's history. "It was really difficult to close out the match. I tried to stay calm," said Alcaraz.

373.title: Bandh in 10 Odisha districts, groups demand separate Koshal state
373.article_body: Two organisations - Koshal Raej Mukti Morcha and Koshal Sena - observed a 12-hour bandh in about 10 districts of Odisha on Wednesday, demanding for a separate state of Koshal. The groups claimed that the western part of the state has been neglected by the government. Offices, courts, educational institutions, shops and markets remained closed in several districts.

374.title: Mercedes to send ECM of car in Mistry's accident to Germany for analysis: Official
374.article_body: Mercedes-Benz India is sending the Electronic Control Module (ECM) of the car in which former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry was killed, to Germany for analysis, said an official. The ECM's analysis can help identify technical issues like brake failure or low brake fluid. In a statement, Mercedes-Benz India said it is cooperating with the authorities investigating the car crash.

375.title: Afghanistan's behaviour not acceptable, even India players are kissing, hugging us: Akhtar
375.article_body: Ex-Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar criticised Afghanistan cricketers' behaviour in their Asia Cup 2022 Super 4 stage match against Pakistan. Akhtar alleged Afghanistan players misbehaved with Asif Ali after dismissing him. "Afghanistan's behaviour isn't acceptable. Even, Team India players are kissing and hugging us. Despite being our brothers, Afghanistan players are misbehaving with us," he stated.

376.title: Artist collapses, dies of heart attack on stage in Jammu; video surfaces
376.article_body: An artist died of heart attack after collapsing on stage during a performance at an event in Jammu, officials have said. A video, which has surfaced on social media, shows the artist dancing before collapsing. Many in the audience thought it was part of the dance performance, reports quoting sources said.

377.title: Many metro barricades removed in Mumbai for Ganesh Visarjan tomorrow
377.article_body: The Mumbai Metropolitan Region Development Authority (MMRDA) removed metro barricades from major locations ahead of Ganpati visarjan on Friday. Metro barricades were removed at Santoshi Mata Mandir, following a request from Lalbaugcha Raja Ganesh Mandal. "On Western Express Highway near green naala, out of 270 metres of barricading, 120 metres have been removed," MMRDA's SVR Srinivas said.

378.title: Hong Kong journalists union's Chairman arrested over disorderly conduct
378.article_body: Ronson Chan, Chairman of the Hong Kong Journalists Association (HKJA) has been arrested over accusations of disorderly conduct and obstruction of a police official. According to Chan's employer, Channel C, Chan was reporting when he allegedly refused to show his ID to police officers who said he was "acting suspiciously". Chan had earlier worked with online news platform StandNews.

379.title: I became unwell: Nargis Fakhri on her absence from Bollywood
379.article_body: Actress Nargis Fakhri, speaking about her absence from the industry, said she became unwell. "I was going through too much mental and physical stress. I had a lot of physical ailments that were interfering with my daily life," Nargis stated. She added, "I knew it in my mind...I had to take a break because I wasn't the happiest person."

380.title: It will play key role in Cong's rejuvenation: Sonia Gandhi on 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'
380.article_body: Congress' 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' will play a decisive role in the rejuvenation of Congress, party interim President Sonia Gandhi said. "It's going to be a transformational moment in the history of Indian politics," Sonia Gandhi added. "Those who cannot be physically present will participate...in thought and spirit. Come, let's take a pledge to move forward united," she stated.

381.title: Jammu professor accused of sexually harassing students dies by suicide
381.article_body: A 45-year-old associate professor at the University of Jammu allegedly died by suicide on Wednesday, police said. This comes a day after he was suspended following a complaint of sexual harassment against him by some students. Police found his body hanging inside his residential quarter, an official said. The deceased had been staying with his family on the university campus.

382.title: Thief steals bank's intranet router mistaking it for video recorder in G'gram
382.article_body: Daily operations at State Bank of India's (SBI) branch in Gurugram's Narsinghpur were put on halt on Tuesday after a thief stole an intranet router mistaking it for a digital video recorder of CCTV camera, bank officials said. "Due to this, we had to shut the bank on Tuesday because no routine work could be done," senior bank official said.

383.title: This progress is not ordinary: PM Modi on India becoming world's 5th largest economy
383.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Thursday said, "India has become fifth largest economy in the world. This progress is not ordinary and we need to maintain this enthusiasm." He said this while addressing an event in Gujarat virtually. India overtook UK and is now behind just the US, China, Japan and Germany.

384.title: Looking forward to starting from zero: Ajinkya Rahane
384.article_body: Veteran India batter Ajinkya Rahane, who will return to competitive cricket in the Duleep Trophy, has said that he's looking forward to starting from "zero". "I don't want to think about my past or future; it's about being in the moment," he added. Rahane picked a groin injury in IPL 2022 and hasn't played since then.

385.title: InterGlobe Aviation shares fall 3.3% on Gangwal's stake sale news
385.article_body: Shares of InterGlobe Aviation, the operator of IndiGo airline, fell by 3.3% to ₹1,919 apiece on BSE in Thursday's opening trade. This development followed news of IndiGo Co-founder Rakesh Gangwal, his family and their trust looking to sell a 2.8% stake in InterGlobe Aviation through a block deal. At 11.54 am, InterGlobe shares were trading at ₹1,933.35 apiece on BSE.

386.title: Hackers steal data of UP colleges, demand $1 million in crypto
386.article_body: Hackers allegedly stole data of multiple colleges run by KN Modi Foundation in Uttar Pradesh and demanded $1 million in cryptocurrency. According to Sandeep Kumar Yadav, an official of the foundation, the hackers stole personal data of students, parents and staff, along with bank details and confidential e-files. They encrypted all files in the server, added Yadav.

387.title: EU plans to cap Russian gas price as Putin threatens to cut supplies
387.article_body: The European Union has proposed a price cap on Russian gas after President Vladimir Putin threatened to cut all energy supplies. "We must cut Russia's revenues which Putin uses to finance this atrocious war in Ukraine," European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen said. Europe, which imports about 40% of gas from Russia, accused the country of weaponising energy supplies.

388.title: India hiked oil imports from Russia by 6 times to tackle inflation: FM
388.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Thursday said India increased oil imports from Russia to 12% from 2% earlier to tackle inflation, adding that central banks across the globe are working in tandem to tame inflation. She also defended the export duties on iron and steel, saying that it was done to bring prices down and "it has shown good results".

389.title: Let us know when it folds: Samsung during iPhone 14 series launch
389.article_body: As Apple launched its latest iPhone 14 series on Wednesday, Samsung Mobile US tweeted, "Let us know when it folds." Samsung had revealed its latest batch of foldable phones last month. In an apparent reference to the new Apple Watch Ultra, Samsung also tweeted, "Nice. A little boxy, but nice. We prefer a round shape ourselves. Classic."

390.title: 4-yr-old girl run over by school bus while getting off in Faridabad, dies
390.article_body: A four-year-old girl died after she was allegedly run over by her school bus while getting off near her house in Faridabad on Wednesday, police said. The incident took place around 2 pm on Narhavli road, police added. "We've registered a case against the bus driver on the complaint of the girl's family...driver is yet to be arrested," police stated.

391.title: Bomb threat rumour at Amritsar school, traced to 3 Class 9 students: Police
391.article_body: A bomb threat rumour at DAV Public School on Lawrence Road in Punjab's Amritsar was spread by three Class 9 students, police said. The rumours were traced to them within hours following which they were detained, police added. Notably, while the bomb rumour went viral on Instagram, another post on firing in the same school was shared on WhatsApp.

392.title: Famous 'Launda Naach' performer Ramachandra Manjhi passes away
392.article_body: Bhojpuri folk dancer and famous 'Launda Naach' performer Ramachandra Manjhi has passed away. In January 2021, he was awarded the Padma Shri in the field of Arts. Ramachandra Manjhi, who began his career as an actor, singer and dancer at the age of 12, had worked with and trained under the legendary Bhikhari Thakur.

393.title: So wrong: Sona after Ranbir-Alia not allowed to visit Ujjain temple
393.article_body: Singer Sona Mohapatra reacted after Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt did not visit the Mahakaleshwar temple in Ujjain due to protests over Ranbir's comments on consuming beef. Taking to Twitter, she wrote, "This is just so...wrong India. Let's not descend into ochlocracy...Sick & dangerous precedent to set and nothing heroic in any remote way."

394.title: You were mean to Ananya Panday on 'Koffee...': Ishaan tells Karan Johar
394.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar, on his show 'Koffee With Karan 7', asked Ishaan Khatter about him breaking up with actress Ananya Panday. To this, Ishaan replied, "Did I? You told Ananya...she broke up with me. I did watch that episode (featuring Ananya). You were rather mean to her." Ishaan told Karan he was "drilling and grilling" Ananya over their relationship.

395.title: Napoli stun Liverpool; Barca, Tottenham register wins in Champions League
395.article_body: Champions League group stage Matchday One concluded on Wednesday night with Barcelona, Tottenham, Atletico Madrid and Bayern Munich registering wins in their respective games. Liverpool, however, suffered a 1-4 defeat against Napoli. Notably, Barcelona registered the biggest win, scoring five goals against Czech side Viktoria Plzen. Robert Lewandowski scored thrice for the Catalans in their match.

396.title: S Korea offers to talk to N Korea to unify families separated during war
396.article_body: South Korea offered to hold talks with North Korea to discuss reunion of families who were separated during the 1950-53 Korean War. South Korea's Unification Minister Kwon Young-se said that Seoul will consider Pyongyang's preferences in deciding the date, venue, agenda and format of the talks. This comes at a time when North Korea is strengthening its weapons arsenal.

397.title: realme announces offers worth ₹700 crore for realme Festive Day sale
397.article_body: realme announced the realme Festive Days sale with offers worth ₹700 crore, including up to ₹10,000 discount on smartphones and up to ₹12,000 discount on AIoT products. Users can avail discounts through realme.com, Flipkart, Amazon, & mainline stores. It also introduced the realme Savings Pass, redeemable after the sale goes live for benefits worth ₹1000, plus additional benefits.

398.title: Went to buy undergarments: J'khand CM's brother on his Delhi visit amid political crisis
398.article_body: Responding to a question on his Delhi visit during the political crisis in Jharkhand, CM Hemant Soren's brother Basant said, "I had run out of undergarments, so I went to Delhi to purchase them. I get them from Delhi." MLAs of ruling coalition in Jharkhand were taken to a resort in Congress-ruled Chhattisgarh last month amid fear of defection.

399.title: Mumbai woman loses ₹3.8 lakh trying to buy wine online
399.article_body: A 47-year-old woman from Mumbai's Bandra was cheated of ₹3.8 lakh while trying to order wine worth ₹2,000 online, said police. She dialled the number of what she believed to be a local wine outlet she found on Google. The fraudster tricked her into revealing her bank details and OTP, after which the money was debited.

400.title: IMD predicts heavy rain in B'luru for next 2 days, says worst not over yet
400.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) predicted heavy rainfall in Bengaluru for the next two days and said that the "worst is not over yet". According to the weather office, the city recorded 251.4 mm of rain in the last four days. Bengaluru witnessed 131.6 mm of rainfall on Sunday, the highest 24-hour precipitation in September in 34 years, IMD said.
